This movie is one of the greats. Don't be swayed by the "Uptight's" who lack a sense of humor. They need laying... either in the bedroom or in a coffin.

This movie isn't funny at all.I think this movie was made for little kids.I cant believe it scored a PG-13 rating it should have been a r rating in my opinion.It was disgusting - I really really wanted to give it a 0 star rating but it isn't possible so a 1 star rating is very generous in my opinion.Comedy is still one of my favorite genres and I will still continue to watch comedy movies.I cant believe i wasted 90 or so minutes watching this movie it was torture! From now on if i want to watch a movie I will read reviews and if it gets enough good reviews then i will watch it.

If you think the commercials were funny (i did) then you will see where Im coming from and agree it is not funny once you watch this movie.Don't watch this movie if nothing else is on.

0 stars out of 10.It is the worst movie of all time

Just to start, not one laugh throughout what I watched of this, not even a smirk or chuckle.

For any of you unfortunate enough to view the train wreck that was epic movie, this film is pretty much more of the same.

All of the jokes were completely uninspired and plain lame, and a few had even been done before (random beating up of a kid like in scary movie 3). It is very possible to reference/spoof current films or popular culture well I'm sure, but as far as the "... movie" type series goes, they should honestly stop now.

Not only was this film awful in itself, but it managed to spectacularly and ruthlessly ruin one of the really good film moments of recent years. I refer to the "THIS IS SPARTA!" scene in 300. They plugged the joke to death and further. Just when you thought that was the last unamusing pop culture reference he was going to kick down that hole NO! another one appears to drag on the hopelessly pathetic gag for another minute or two.

The straw that broke the camels back though, was the dance off scene against the "immortals". I simply could not stand another minute of the mind numbing drivel that I had already tolerated for what must have been about 45 interminably monotonous minutes.

Avoid this movie like the plague, it really isn't worth it.

I really wanted this to be funny. Yet with zero laughs this movie ended up making me hate it by bringing down 300 which is a super bad-ass movie. If you watch the trailer you will get the most laughs possible from this movie. Even the laughs in the trailer are ruined by the garbage that actually surrounds it in the actual movie. If this movie were 30 seconds long i would have given it a 10. How can you ruin a scene where brittany spears is kicked into a bottomless pit? unwatchable. yea and alright i friggin get it its easy to make gay jokes about Greek soldiers. no reason to waste millions of dollars and 2hrs of my life nailing that point down. Jesus how many lines do they want me to put down here. I suppose i can continue to bad mouth this steaming pile of garbage. When I first saw the original "Scary movie" previews i was afraid they were trying to belittle the movies they were spoofing. But after watching it I was relived that it was really funny. .Meet the spartans was everything i feared scarymovie was.

Let me begin by saying that I actually enjoy spoof movies. Correction - I enjoyed spoof movies.

This is single handedly the worst movie I've ever seen in our outside a theatre and the first one I walked out after 20 minutes.

Just in order to make you understand what it is - Movie is an art form, so let's compare it to a music concert for a second. Now...imagine sitting at a concert where the singer screams ugly sounds instead of singing, the supporting band plays nothing but noise the stage setting is a used toilet paper (which I think the script of this movie was written on) etc....

Awful MOVIE! AWFUL!!! Should I repeat that 5 times, like the filmmakers did with every dumb joke in the movie? AWFUL, AWFUL, awful, Awful!!! AwFuL!! 1) The sophistication of the humor in this movie levels someone around 1st and 2nd grades. However, it most likely would make them cry rather than laugh.

2) Do you really have to explain any obvious idiotic joke in the movie? What? Is it too complicated for us dumb viewers? There is nothing to explain! It is not funny! - explain that! 3) OK. Among all the crap they assembled in this movie. One joke had a vague potential of being slightly amusing. SO LETS REPEAT IT trizillion times!!!! and then once more! 4) The most outrages scenes from Jackass are done with much more taste than this vulgar and obscene...I can't even call it a movie...visual pollution To summarize I really think that certain movies should be banned from the theatres and possibly altogether. This is an insult! The directors should be ashamed of themselves.

What's happening to Hollywood? Sad...just sad.

review_title: This was actually funny at times
It's impossible to write a review of this movie!
review_detailed_main:
I mean, it's impossible to review this movie without making the review sound just as bad as the movie itself. But why am I stating the obvious? Of course it's bad. Anyone whose aware of the collective works of the notoriously untalented Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer know this is bad. Anyone who doesn't know need not apply. I can't believe I'm saying this but there are more substantial train wrecks than this horrible, disgusting, unfunny, idiotic, pathetic, shameless, inconsistent, insulting, asinine, foolish, oafish, and insignificant (I need to look up more words in the dictionary to describe this movie) waste of time and money (but since I mercifully saw it on TV, at least I'm not guilty at wasting any cash).

It's probably much more fun to write a review about this piece of crap by imagining how Friedberg and Seltzer came up with this incredible idea.

Friedberg: "Hey! I just saw 300 man! It was awesome! But you know what's more awesome? Why don't we make a comedy about it? I mean come on! These guys are wearing like, what are those, skirts? Are they gay or something? Why don't we make a movie where these Spartan dudes are gay! People will dig that right? I mean they dig anything 300 these days!"

Seltzer: "Yeah man, that will be, like, awesome too! I mean I was thinking of like doing a spoof on pop culture icons like the guys in American Idol or Ryan Seacrest or Britney or Paris Hilton or even those guys in Stomp the Yard and Step Up. And then maybe we can riff on TV commercials as well. But I guess we'll go with your idea. After all, my ideas suck! I didn't even like it!"

Friedberg: "Are you f#&@ing kidding? That's brilliant! Tell you what, we'll combine our ideas together to make a masterpiece. Yeah! This will be big! I'm having an epiphany right know! Wait a minute... Epipihany, what does that mean anyway? Never mind, so here it is: We set this in the same time as 300. That was like, before the first World War, right? So these 300 dudes are like gay right? So we'll just remake the whole story of 300 only make it funny. Yeah, and we'll put in those pop culture references of yours and that will just be a gas! I mean, that Leonidas guy pushes Britney, the judges of Idol, Ryan Seacrest down the Pit of Doom! And then there would be, like, a hip-hop showdown between Spartans and Persians. Yeah, people will laugh so wild that this might just be a classic like AIRPLANE! Yeah, this is gonna be big!"

Seltzer: "Nice one man! I mean your like f#&@ing Spielberg man! Only Spielberg never thought of having that guy from Borat playing Xerxes or have Rocky, Ghost Rider, that dancing penguin from Happy Feet, and Carmen Electra in one movie! By the way, Spielberg did this movie with this guy Bay about Transformers. I was thinking, why not put in a giant robot? People will laugh like crazy, man! I mean, we don't have the budget, but hey, we made that classic EPIC MOVIE without having to spend lots of cash. And while were at it, there's got to be like product placements here so people will know we threw in everything on this movie. Nothing is safe from our riffing. Man I love working with you!

Friedberg: "Yeah man! Me too man! I mean, we're like that guy Hitchcock and that guy Jim Stewart. Or that guy Spielberg and Lucas. We make one hell of a team. I mean, who needs the critics? I don't even read their reviews! I don't even read! Now, let's make this baby a reality!"

Setlzer: "Way ahead of you man! Nicole Parker's already on board and some guy Sean Maguire too. Wait, 'some guy Sean Macguire'? Hey that rhymes! So anyway, lets do this! People are, like, waiting for our next movie! This is like freakin' STAR WARS EPISODE I all over again! Maybe this time, we'll have guys camping in front of the theaters just to be first in line to get tickets! Man, I love Hollywood!"

Friedberg: "Oh by the way man, one last thing. What if the movie sucked?"

Rating: 0 out of 5.

review_title: Much better than a "1" but certainly no "10"
review_detailed_main: Any spoof with strong production values deserves some credit for effort and "Meet the Spartans" gets high marks for set designs and costumes. Actors perform their material well. There are a number of funny bits in this film, but it falls short of ranking as a great spoof. The primary reason is it strayed too frequently from the genre represented by "300." Think of a great spoof, like "Airplane." It had great bits taken from the Airport series of films as well as the classic from the 50's, "The High and the Mighty." Meet the Spartans might have turned out better if they had stuck to "300" and films like "Alexander," "Troy," and others of the genre. Instead, they branched out in all directions including TV shows and personalities. In the final analysis, they only had enough good material for a skit on Saturday Night Live. The rest was filler. Not a total waste of time (as implied by the 55% voting "1") but not great either.

Don't misunderstand me. I'm a fan of satire, and parodies alike. But this was absolutely RIDICULOUS. I love parodies and comedy, but this just about made a mockery of all of it. Parody movies rarely have a definite plot, but this one didn't even have an INdefinite one. Please, don't waste your money.

What really amazed me about the movie was that all the "censored" bits of nudity didn't get the film a well-deserved R-rating. I don't know who was in charge, but apparently someone missed something. Absolute rubbish.

1/10, and I don't even have a film standard to accompany this load. If you want to see a better satire movie, go and watch Robin Hood: Men in Tights. It's MUCH better than this.

review_title: Absurd spoof plenty of silly jokes, embarrassment comedy , bad taste and lunatic humor
review_detailed_main:
This is a lousy spoof based on the famous film directed by Zack Snyder and based on sensational Frank Miller's comic book. This slapdash movie packs a nonstop string of rough gags that holds up almost to the ending. It's full of fart jokes, bad taste, kinky sex, really lame scenes, and foul-mouthed language spliced in whole film . Here are badly brought to life the heroics deeds about battle of Thermopylae, the only trail to arrive Athens . The events(480 B.C) are ridiculously developed, these are the following : King Leonidas (Sean MacGuire in the role of Gerard Butler) seeks advise to oracle(Christina Flanagan become into Ugly Betty)and establishes an alliance with Greeks polis facing the invading Persian army. Leonidas leaves his wife Queen (Carmen Electra in similar role of Lena Headey) and son , leading a small army formed by a captain(Kevin Sorbo in the character of Vincent Regan), accompanied by his son (Travis Van Winkle : Tom Wisdom look-a-like), and several others. The army called Falange is constituted by various Spartans named Hoplitas wielding the shield Heplon and long lances . The almost 300 hold off an immense Persian army commanded by king Xerxes(Ken Davitian in the role of Rodrigo Santoro). Meantime in Sparta are happening intrigues surrounding the Greek council whose protagonists are the Queen Margo, and Traitor( Diedrich Bader in similar role to Dominic West) . A hunchbacked wanna-be warrior woman (Nicole Parker, a Paris Hilton look-a-like, in similar character to Andrew Tiernan), informed Persians of a hidden way that could utilize to besiege the Spartans.

From the start to the ending the coarse humor and the laughters are innumerable. Lots of gags and sketch, some of them funny but the movie lacks freshness. This is a hilarious parody,surrealist,extreme spoof and gross-out . As always the cinematographic references are numerous and provide silly laughs from start to finish,the amusement is guess what films result to be as Skull Rider, Rocky ,Borat, and TV contests . The picture contains loads of silly fun here and there and a passel of cameo appearances . Stay tuned through final credits with the cast singing and dancing . The film produced by Arnon Milchan is awfully directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer. The motion picture will appeal to vulgar humor enthusiasts and stupid comedy buffs. Rating : Bottom of barrel , a real turkey.

Those who haven't seen the movie "300" probably won't get most of the jokes in "Meet the Spartans," and those who HAVE seen it probably won't get them either. That's because for any audience this is one of the worst, most jaw-droppingly witless parodies in motion picture history (and that's saying quite a lot).

Suffice it to say that this slapdash mixture of gladiator-movie clichés and truly lame pop culture references has enough homophobic jokes to set the cause of gay rights back a good quarter of a century or more (OK, these Spartan warriors like men; we get it, we get it!).

Indicative of the movie's utter failure at pacing and timing are two scenes - one at the "pit of death" and another featuring a step-dance competition between the Greeks and the Persians - that drone on for a minor eternity. But then the whole movie goes on too long - 86 minutes too long to be exact.

review_title: a must-see for all those who are desperate for some quality comedy!!!!!!
review_detailed_main:
After setting a very high standard for quality comedies with Date Movie and Epic Movie, 2 of the most respected directors in Hollywood Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzerare back with yet another insanely funny spoof "Meet The Spartans" and I have to say that this is EVEN better than the last two! (Who would have thought?)

Unlike other recent comedies (Superbad anyone?) the jokes are classy and clever and non-stop from start to finish. Not a second goes by without the audience laughing their heads off to the quality comedy they are watching. Almost everyone in the theater I watched it was rolling on the ground from laughter. A few losers walked out after a few minutes which just goes to show that there's no pleasing EVERYONE.

Overall an extremely funny spoof (possibly even better than Airplane!) that is a must-see for everyone, even if comedy is not your thing, you still need to watch this as it may change the way you look at comedies.

A brilliant 10/10!

review_title: This "movie" gives parodies a bad name
review_detailed_main:
This has got to be the worst movie I have ever seen, and believe me, I have seen many bad movies. The humor is absolutely pathetic. And before some of you accuse me that I didn't understand this movie, I want to tell you that I love parodies, and that I didn't care much for "300". Also, I am 24 years old, not 50 or more. Trust me, there is nothing to understand about this movie. There is no excuse for this POS. It feels like the script for this movie was written by a 13 year old. These days everybody thinks they can make a movie.

The only reason I watched it until the end was because I couldn't believe how bad it is, I just wanted to see how low you could get. This movie gives parodies a bad name. In fact, this movie gives movies a bad name. It is a complete waste of money and time. They might have been better off showing a piece of crap on a plate for the entire length of the movie, I think it would have been less repulsive. The sooner I can forget this movie, the better.

The reason I'm writing this review is to tell you this: please people, stop paying to see crappy movies like this, let them just go out of business because they deserve it.

review_title: Meet the Spartans? I'd rather meet my maker, thanks.
review_detailed_main:
This is one of a few select movies I have watched in my lifetime that I have been both physically and mentally unable to reach the end. The first 30 minutes of it was enough to make me realise that had I watched the second half, I would be one day lying on my death bed wishing that I would have spent that time doing something more beneficial such as picking the fluff out of my belly button.

Everything about this film is completely wrong. The only redeeming feature is that it's good to know that Sean Maguire - who made my ears bleed in the early nineties with a short lived career in pop - wasn't actually getting as successful in the states as the rumours I'd heard had stated.

review_title: I think most people took this movie way too seriously
review_detailed_main:
I am certainly in the minority but this movie just dumped all of the 90-2000s pop culture in to the death pit. People who have actually seen 300 can enjoy it to the fullest! Plus if they have enough knowledge of the references that has been brought in the mix with ancient Greece.

It's 2018 and I have watched it again! It certainly stood out to be one of the best parodies of all times, IMO (besides scary movie series).

P.S: Carmen Electra is drop dead hot!

review_title: Meet the Spartans was a pretty decent time-waster for me
review_detailed_main: Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, the writer-directors of last years' mostly unfunny spoof Epic Movie, serve the same position on Meet the Spartans. Now, while I thought EM went all over the place in taking every pop culture item without any consistency in characterization and therefore made no sense whatsoever, I actually thought MTS stayed close to its source (300) and only went slightly overboard in going on other tangents (this time on reality programs like "American Idol", "America's Next Top Model", "Dancing with the Stars", and "Deal or No Deal"). Besides, I actually thought much of the material here was funnier than EM. Maybe I'm in a better mood than I was last year when I saw EM with a friend and his then 13-year-old nephew and his best friend with some worry about certain scenes being seen by them. Here, at least I know what to expect and its only with the friend. So in summary, I laughed at most of the pop culture references and many of the scandals that happened in the previous year (Paris Hilton, Britney Spears, Lindsay Lohan). And many of the bad taste homosexual jokes were funny both to me and my gay friend. So if you feel like wasting a couple of hours just for fun, Meet the Spartans should do the trick if you don't feel like seeing the latest Oscar-nominated film.

Never in my life have I've seen such a downright unfunny, self-indulgent piece of crap that is Meet the Spartans and I say that with honest and utmost sincerity. There are better spoof movies than this(see Naked Gun series, Airplane! and Kentucky Fried Movie) for crying out loud!!! Friedberg and co really believe that their "material" based on pop culture references is funny. It's not. You can get the same experience just by drinking alcohol or getting high. THAT is an understatement. With people's tastes in movies nowadays, its supply and demand. The more you watch, the more crap like this studios will churn out over and over again. I've never hated myself so much so that suicide would be a preferable option.

I usually enjoy spoof movies just to get kicks, but this is the worst spoof movie ever. I only chuckled once and nearly puked the other times because it was so bad. There is no need to describe the plot. The plot is basically the same as 300 with American culture things thrown it. I think that the creators of this movie went overboard with the gay jokes. The creators have to know that gay jokes are funny at a minimum, not like in this movie. The only reason I gave this movie a 3 because the joke regarding Britney Spears is a bit funny and Carmen Electra is pretty. Other than this, I found out the hard way that I should not watch this tripe. My warning to others: Do not waste your money renting or buying the DVD unless you want an hour and twenty minutes of torture. I rate this movie 3/10.

When I went in the see this movie, to be honest, I didn't expect much at all. After seeing how unfunny Epic Movie was, I expected this movie to be the same. Unsurprisingly, I was right, as this movie was nothing more than a bunch of childish unfunny jokes.

At the start of the movie, I tried to laugh at the jokes. But as the film progressed, I found myself actually amazed at how this movie didn't go straight to DVD. Sure, I'll give the makers one or two moments that had a slight bit of humor, but all the jokes were extremely dragged on, to the point that I nearly fell asleep in the middle of a "joke". It left me thinking that the film-makers tried way too hard to make people laugh, that they ended up making an unfunny product.

I left the cinema feeling ripped off (the first time I had ever felt this about a film). Trying to think of funny parts of the film was hard, as there were not a lot of them. The only reason I would want to see this movie again is for the scenes with Carmen Electra.

How films like this continue to get made is very perplexing. This isn't even a movie, it is just a bunch of skits thrown together to use up 75 minutes worth of film. I can't even begin to tell you how anyone thought this was funny enough to make a movie. I didn't even pay to see this, and I'm still embarrassed to admit that I saw it.

All this does is take pop culture references and some of last years so called hit films and somehow mishmashes them together. When you have Rocky Balboa, the fat guy from Borat and lots of dancing based on Dancing with The Stars and other dance films, all mixed together, the result is destined to be the IMDb's worst ranked films in the top 250 futile films. I laughed when Britney got thrown into the pit of despair, and that's about it. But the rest of the jokes are so one dimensional, and so void of any intellect, that they have to repeat the same ones three of four times. There weren't even enough jokes to fill a 75 minute film. I guess there is a market for this type of entertainment or it wouldn't gross 18 mill on it's first weekend, but the humour is sad, the film making is terrible and the writing is a travesty.

What a sad state Hollywood is in when crap like this gets made.

0/10

review_title: This Movie Was Not Even Screened For Critics
review_detailed_main: I saw on the trivia that it wasn't screened then when i saw this i realized that THESE GUYS KNOW THEMSELVS THAT THEY ARE HORRIBLE FILM MAKERS they don't even want to be told that there movie is so bad. they just KEEP MAKING MILLIONS. some people don't know a good comedy if it hit them in the face This IS the worst movie i have ever seen IF U LIKE STOLEN JOKES PLEASE SEE IT A lot OF THEM ARE JUST TAKEN FROM OTHER MOVIES 1 out of 10 this movie was WORSE THEN TRASH If anyone wants to ever become a filmmaker or a director these are one of the movies you should watch for inspiration and say to yourself every second u watch "I could make a better movie then this"

I know i shouldn't even comment as i haven't even seen the film yet, however it looks exactly the same as Scary Movie 3/4 (the first 2 were tolerable!)Date Movie, Epic Movie all of which weren't remotely funny plus others i just can't be bothered tio think of. And i wonder who watched these thought they where funny and decided to do YET again another spoof film. Its always the same predictable jokes and characters, i saw the trailer and that was enough to decide NOPE, Ain't WATCHING IT. Please please please, whoever is producing or thinking of producing another spoof film for 2009, Don't. Leave it with the Airplanes and Naked gun, enoughs enough.

This was by far the worst movie I have ever seen. I approached it expecting low-brow humor and parodies but it really wasn't funny at all.

Not only did they have to point out every attempt at a joke, the humor was just not there. I wish I could have my 90 minutes back.

If I would have wasted my money in a theater to sit through this crappy attempt of a movie then I would have asked for my money back after the first 10 minutes.

To be fair, I could see a whole theater full of Jerry Springer guests whooping and hollering.. so if you fit in that demographic by all means enjoy this trash-terpiece.

The only satisfaction you will get from this flick is if you pick this movie up and give it to the person you hate most. That way you can feel as if you murdered apart of them when they watch it.

If for some morbid reason you still feel the need to watch this or are just mildly retarded.I would go with the ladder and just stab yourself in the face a few dozen times. Not only will it be more entertaining you will be less bored.In fact your friends will find it more comical than this film.

If you are Hardcore and wish to test your willpower and endurance this is the perfect movie. I will advise however it will shave 5 yrs off your life. Do you know how it feels to be loved? If so watch this and you will know how it feels to be worthless. Do you know what it feels like to be worthless? Well watch this and you will probably off yourself.

review_title: I'm so glad this film is a hit!
review_detailed_main: I'm a sophisticated film lover living in Canada. My taste runs to Fellini and Bergman. Yet I am very grateful that this little unpretentious year-end pantomime review of Hollywood's worst cinematic excesses is reaching its intended public. There is nothing wrong with a swift kick in the pants of subjects and individuals who should know better. As far as I am concerned, no parody will ever make fun ENOUGH of the belligerent, war-mongering, fascistic, racist, sadistic and homophobic aspects of "300". No film will humiliate ENOUGH the downgrading of Western civilization that are Britney Spears and Paris Hilton and the US obsession with celebrity, however undeserved. People go to this film because they crave its subject matter: bad movies passing as art, insane celebrities passing as human beings. They come away from it complaining that it is too vulgar, but apparently never take time to reflect that is exactly what their so-called culture has become: a quagmire of artlessness, violent acts, crude humour and body fluids. Everyone should thank the writers for telling it like it is.

only a 5 year old would laugh at all the dumb lines. There's no plot there's no good characters or anything. Also this movie is short which is actually really good makes you suffer less from this crapfest. and why is there 1000 people that gave this movie a 10? Are you being serious this movie is one of the worst movies I have seen in a very long time. Avoid this movie at all cost don't even rent it, Hollywood needs to think twice at doing a parody, I miss the good ol movies like Airplane! even the first Scary Movie wasn't to bad so I suggest you to do instead of wasting the money on buying a movie ticket you should use that money and rent Airplane! at least you will get some laughs off at the movie 1\10 for Meet the Spartans

review_title: All That Is Wrong With The World.
review_detailed_main: One of the worst things I've ever seen. The moments I smiled a bit, the marching with the blue screens at the end for instance, did not make up for the multiple scenes with projectile vomiting, and the constant horribly tacked on inclusion of the worst of TMZ culture Brittany Spears, American Idol, Paris Hilton, game shows like Deal Or No Deal, Dance Movies, etc. Probably the worst movie of the year. It's sad to see Kevin Sorbo and even Method Man sinking this low. I'm really amazed that even in the days of "Scary", "Epic", "Teenage", and "Superhero" movies, ala (Superhero Movie), that something as bad as this could still be made, and could take in as much at the box office and on video as it surely will. 300 may have been homophobic, and self indulgent, but no movie deserves a parody of this quality.

Last year I saw a movie that left me speechless, literally speechless. Atonement, Stardust, Pirates of the Caribbean, hell they all had me talking happily afterwards, but Epic Movie, that just left me stone cold. I absolutely despised it, an unfunny, lousy excuse for a movie that made me horrified that people actually laughed in the cinema. I vowed never to watch that movie again and thankfully to this day I have not seen it again. However today, out of pure interest I ventured into Meet the Spartans. I didn't expect a good movie, in fact I only saw it to see if it was possible that a worse movie than Epic Movie could be made. And the movie did not disappoint. Meet the Spartans is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen in my life! I smiled once, mainly due to the randomness of the sequence, and the rest of it I spent in loathing. So many films are spoofed in this movie, and yet none of the spoofs are funny. 300, Shrek the Third, Transformers, Happy Feet, Ugly Betty, American Idol and unfortunately so many more movies and TV shows make a random and annoying appearance here. They mention Heroes and Star Wars as well, two of my most beloved things on the planet, just for them to be mentioned is rubbing salt in the already deep and painful wound this movie caused. The movie is also never funny, it tries to be funny, and admittedly unlike Epic Movie this did seem to be making an effort. But it just never pulls it off, the "I will survive" sketch involving the Spartans was admittedly funny, but it was overdone and then they repeated the scene again to no effect whatsoever! The performances are pathetic, the spoofing just annoying, in fact there are next to no positives about this movie whatsoever. The majority of the audience did not laugh once in my screen, which was a good thing as it might finally mean that we will see an end to this ridiculous spoofs. But alas, Superhero Movie was advertised just before this, and that looks quite poor as well.

So let me go onto the performances. In spoof movies nowadays I never expect a decent performance, in fact the only actor I ever rely on in a spoof movie is Leslie Nielson, who thankfully did not sign on for this wretched movie. Instead we get Sean Maguire, whose CV includes EastEnders, unfortunately that pretty much explains the extent of his talent right there. Maguire ranges from stupidly annoying (the earlier scenes where he plays a teenage Leonidas practically being unbearable to watch), to just about bearable (I did see a hint of charisma in the Deal or No Deal sketch, just a hint mind you). Maguire just really isn't that talented an actor, or at least he can't show off any talent here because the writers seem to be making the thing up as they go along. Carmen Elektra turns up in her unfortunately extended role. Elektra isn't the best actress ever, and she has made a habit of showing up in these damned movies. Here she is tolerable at times, but generally she is there to look sexy and that's it. Ken Davitian turns up if only to pay for the bills as Xerxes. Okay he's reasonably amusing at times, but her shows up barely at all, and by the time he ends up as a Transformer (seriously don't ask) I just felt sorry for the poor actor. The rest of the cast, oh who cares to be honest. They're all as bad as one another for signing onto this piece of garbage.

And here we get to the rest of the bad stuff in Meet the Spartans, brace yourselves as there is a lot. Firstly the humour is way off target. All we get are a series of fart jokes, break dances, pop culture references, and that's it. Britney Spears shows up to be laughed at twice in the movie, a fact I found closer to bullying than funny. The Pit of Death sequence is stupid and not even remotely funny, once you've seen three people kicked in you want to cry, then we get at least another two loads of people kicked in! American Idol shows up way too often, it wasn't funny first time and it certainly isn't the third time! The Simon Cowell being nasty routine is very much out of date, sure he criticises but he just paid of a family's mortgage the other day, so we don't really care about the Americans saying how nasty he is all the time any more. 300 is pretty much recreated scene for scene and also poked fun at scene for scene. Trust me if you liked 300 you will just be furious at this movie. I mean whoever would have guessed 300 was slightly homo-erotic? The sketches on Youtube that appeared at the time 300 was released were funnier than this, so all the stuff we see here has been done before and better! I admit to laughing once, the Happy Feet sketch is kind of funny, that's about it to be honest. The break dancing made me contemplate suicide, and the rest of the stuff left me bored and angry.

So here I am, one year later with a new spoof movie to hate for eternity. If you liked Epic Movie, yes there are some of you out there I know, then you may find this a tiny bit amusing. For the sane mortals amongst us however I recommend gouging your eyeballs out with a spoon rather than see this movie!

I can't believe I wasted time and money to see this crap! I took my son to see this, his choice of course, for his birthday. We all (family of 4) left very disappointed. Please believe me! I was not surprised to see the entire theater get up to leave before the end. If you value your dollar, spend it some other way. If you value your time, spend it somewhere else. I could have taken a nap at home. Besides, a sofa is much more comfortable than theater seats. This is no 'Scary Movie'. Spoof flicks should make you laugh. I groaned though 95% of this garbage.(Correction- 'Hot Garbage.' Ewww! Get the point?) Another thing, who ends a movie like that? What a waste!

What a god d**e piece of s**t. Really this bulls**t was the worst "thing" because movie would be a too good title for that awful s**t. (Excuse this word but really) the worst movie ever seen please everyone who didn't see it and think well it couldn't be so bad...believe me it is. Okay to be fair: ONE POINT and I mean only ONE POINT for the first scene with Paris Hilton I had to smile when she came into the scene but the rest...bad jokes bad allusives...I have just waste another hour of my time with this and I'm very glad that it was just one hour. So I think you know what I want to say xD so last sentence: Stay away from meet the spartans it's really not worth it so if you are bored and think I think I should watch a movie today, take everyone but not that piece of crab

review_title: A Nutshell Review: Meet the Spartans
review_detailed_main:
With my workload getting increasingly heavy, and working on super secret projects that hope to see the light of day by end of the year, you should come to expect my reviews here returning to their titular roots, presented as far as possible in capsule style. And I kind of expected it to be so with the first movie I've seen after consciously making that resolution.

Meet the Spartans is a waste of time. It has zero naturally funny moments, and lacked that creative, funny spark that would turn scenes into instant livewires. The gist of it is to poke fun at last year's 300, but what resulted was a whole host of lifeless jokes that do not tickle you at all. Again, it preys rather lazily at the wealth of material offered by pop culture, with references to recent movies galore, and taking the mickey out of celebrities from Lindsay Lohan and Paris Hilton to Sylvester Stallone and many more which only can be seen midway through the end credits roll (which made you wonder, when the credits were rolling, why you see many more cast who don't make it to the story proper).

Again, Carmen Electra vamps it up as a trashy, slutty character, this time Queen Margo, wife of Leonidas (Sean Maguire), with Kevin Sorbo (television's Hercules) as Captain of the Spartan warriors who defend their lands from the invasion of Xerxes (Ken Davitian, Azamat from Borat) and his digital effect Persian army. While there are no big stunt action sequences, what came across was perfectly cheap, from landscapes right down to costumes. And the jokes don't let down from ribbing homosexuality, especially amongst the Spartans, and too much of something makes one sick.

Moreover, there seemed to be a fixation from writers-directors Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer on spoofing one too many television series. From American Idol, to Deal or No Deal, every game show had to be featured, made fun of, and then discarded, and what really irked were the lacklustre lookalikes who, unfortunately, don't look alike at all. Far from it. Expect the usual crass jokes, except this time, the jokes seem to be constipated. It's not funny, and not trying to be funny. I guess there's an art to being funny and making comedies, but Jason and Aaron just don't cut it. While Scary Movie had enough to spawn sequels (which number 4 was quite a let down), Meet the Spartans will join the fates of wannabes like Date Movie and Epic Movie - forgettable. And one wonders why anyone in the right mind will fund projects like these, and also, the various companies with blatant product placements to be associated with junk too.

You might say given that I know what's coming, why bother to watch this in the first place. Guess I'll still have to venture to hell to warn others to keep clear of this turkey. This wholeheartedly deserves to go to the trash bin, and automatically a contender for worst picture of the year. It's a comedy that doesn't even try to be an iota of funny.

It seems like everyday a new spoof comes out that will either be really good or really bad. I have enjoyed all of the Scary Movie films so far, but there have been some films lately that I did not particularly care for. Does Date Movie ring a bell? This movie was awful, and it probably ruined Allyson Hannah's career. Then came Epic Movie, a film that was directed towards ten year-olds who laugh every single time someone gets kicked in the crotch. Yeah, Epic Movie was pretty bad.

Just when I though movies couldn't get any worse, Meet The Spartans came out. This is the worst movie ever, right up there with House Party 4. I have never seen something so disgusting in my entire life. The acting is like a 3rd grade play. The jokes, well; there are no jokes. Just random references to pop culture that are supposed to be funny. It's not like Family Guy either. Family Guy has plenty of funny moments and they make plenty of pop culture references. However, Meet The Spartans is just...well...I did not like it.

I seriously hope that the idiots responsible for this, Epic Movie, and Date Movie die a slow and painful death.

review_title: Not a big screen movie but then again what spoof is!?
review_detailed_main: This is about as good as I expected and so what did I do to prepare myself? After seeing that awful trailer I simply waited for it to arrive on DVD. No spoof movie deserves paying out decent money for and none of them need a big screen to get a laugh. So I ordered the DVD from an online rental company and the cost worked out at about 5p each. I made sure I got enough beer in for myself and mates to enjoy before watching it. I think it fair to say we all had a great laugh (what we managed to see and hear that is) and this film certainly gets the thumbs up from me and my friends. You could say there was a lot wrong with it but then again who really cares!? RECOMMENDED IF WATCHING WHILE VERY DRUNK ONLY!

First of all, I went to see this movie with a physically bad feeling. However, once in the confines of the movie, I forgot about my upset stomach. Knowing the kind of movie it was, and having seen 300 and various other movie references, I found "Meet the Spartans" to have given me what I came for; some good laughs, a chuckle here and there and kept up with the current themes of today.

Next, the humor in it is a specific type - the ones that follow the "Date Movie", "Scary Movie", etc... so know that going in or else you might not have a pleasant experience.

When the movie ended, I felt my stomach tighten up again. If nothing else, it entertained and took my mind off of my illness for a brief while. That's what a movie should do.

review_title: Don't waste an hour of your life watching this.
review_detailed_main:
I went to go see this with a few friends just to distract me from the amount of stress I have had this week. It was either this movie or Jumper, and my friends and I decided what the heck lets just go and see this.

What a mistake. I should have been at home doing homework. It would of been far more exciting.

It was dreadful. If you have seen the trailer, that basically sums up all the whole movie (if you want to call it that) in 30 seconds. The jokes where lame and repeated over and over, it was fake and the acting was pathetic. IT WAS THE WORST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. It's as though someone off the street with no imagination whatsoever said to themselves "Hey! what the heck I'll make a crappy rip off of 300!" My movie ticket said it went for at least an hour and half, but it went for about half of that. I sat in the cinema waiting for the bloody thing to get to the point, but it never did. It had no story whatsoever and the jokes where, well, non-existent.

I want to walk out of the cinema with a good feeling and "money well spent" attitude, but this movie made me go up to the counter and ask for my money back. I felt like crying...I wasted 11 dollars and and an hour of my life on this..."movie."

I didn't even want to rate this....it doesn't deserve even the thought of a rating.

Do not see this movie even if you liked scary movie and epic movie. It made me sick, and your sure to be disappointed too.

When some people look back on their life, their greatest regret will be not spending more time with their children, or not telling that special someone their feelings, or not trying harder in high school and getting a comfortable job. Mine however will be handing over £5.50 of my money to the incompetent duo who made this film and sitting through the 70 most deeply boring/embarrassing minutes of my life in a cinema when I could be doing something more fun. What? Almost anything.

This film has no redeeming features. From the soundtrack, which consists solely of cheap hip-hop and inept remixes of dance songs, to the effects, most of which wouldn't look out of place in an amateur Be Kind Rewindesque fan parody (if you want to parody Transformers, then at LEAST make your vehicles, you know, TRANSFORM), to the acting (clearly they think they can get away with the shoddiest, hammiest high-school play acting, so long as they punctuate it with fanservicey images of Carmen Elektra), is so poorly executed you wonder whether the makers of this film are deliberately doing everything they were told not in film school.

Special mention of course goes to the humour. Whether it's a "hilarious" bodily fluid splatter joke, a very 'political' jab against some Hollywood celebrity (oh, Britney shaving her head! Clever), "postmodern" product-placement (ie, adverts so blatant you just stare on aghast) or a reference to some obscure minutiae of American popular culture (half the reality shows references will be forgotten within a year), there's not an intentional laugh in the film. The only points that even raised a chuckle were: a) the terrible lookalikes (apparently, the only criteria for being a Paris Hilton lookalike is that you are blond), b) the shoddy effects, c) the nonsensical casting of "the fat guy from Borat" as Xerxes and the moronic narrator telling us "Xerxes looked like the fat guy from Borat". See, the thing is, he really didn't.

My only wish is that cinemas gave out refunds. If they did, this film would most definitely be worth your money back.

too horrible to think about this auditory and visual disaster.

if you consider watching this; here is a list of things I recommend instead:

1. invite some friends and have a glass of good wine 2. jump of a cliff

and all things in between, which means; all the good and bad things you can do in life are way better than watching this piece of crap.

the humor was not funny but offensive, the movie that was used as framework is too good to use for a spoof, carmen electra is getting way to old for these "roles" and the only pretty girl in the movie was made to look like lindsay lohan... WHY???

for the producers: do yourself and us a favour, quit the movie business

review_title: The most memorable, beautiful, provoking, engrossing film experiences I have ever had. Better than Godfather and Schindler's list combined...

Meet The Spartans is quite possibly the worst film I have seen. I'd say it's slightly worse than epic movie; Date Movie is a colossal masterpiece in comparison to this inconceivably horrendous film.

review_title: Don't Even Need This Review To Understand This Is Crap
review_detailed_main: The whole movie is of course meant to target 13 year olds to 16 year olds. These are the kids who say, "Have you seen Date Movie?!? Its the best movie ever!". Of course, Meet the Spartans is worse than all those films put together. And this isn't on the bottom 100 list. Why? The main problem with this film is the acting, it blows. The script should be banned from the US. For example:Bond Villain,"Tell me the access code Mr. Bond!" Leonidas in a stupid voice and jerking his head,"Who the hell is Mr.Bond? Im freaking' Leonidas...". Just horrible. This movie is officially not funny. The plot is riddled with holes, the script is terrible, special effects and backdrops suck, cast is crap and the directing is worse than anthing I've ever seen. This movie should be avoided at all costs. The only reason i actually saw this movie(i saw it online for free) is because of Nicole Parker. She is a hilarious talent and shouldn't waste it for this piece of work that they call Meet The Spartans. I give this movie a 1 out of 10.

review_title: Absolutely unfunny in every way ever.
review_detailed_main:
In the most unoriginal movie of the decade, a sparse, vague plot involving 13 Spartans battling a Persian army at Thermopylae, which (is it funny already?) consists mainly of the most clumsy, inept pop culture references of anything popular since December 2006.

From the moment we see Shrek as one of the Spartan babies being inspected, it is more than obvious that whatever money anyone spent on this film was a complete waste and should be refunded with an apology.

Yes, it is that bad. I only found myself seeing it because I attended a movie marathon and this happened to be included in this discounted ticket price. And it was still a rip-off.

This film is a shame to the already severely failing genre of spoof. It is not clever in any way, and the only decent writing in any part of the film are lines directly taken from 300. I hypothesise that these films- Meet the Spartans, Epic Movie and Date Movie- follow the world's most mind-numbing formula;

1. Take movies that have been relatively decent or popular, that people have thought about spoofing and have done so correctly on some occasions, and therefore YOU should not touch, because YOU will fail epically.

2. Strip the plot/s down to the barest, often irrelevant aspects, leaving plenty of room (hopefully at least, in the case of Meet the Spartans, 55 minutes for inane references to everything unfunny ever)for material that is not related to the plot in any way.

3. Make a list of every film that has been relatively popular for the last few years, and make a list of everything that is irrelevant to the plot of the spoof, but is popular to the film, and find ways to pop it in the spoof with the subtlety and skill of a 3 year old painting with a cat. You MUST mention EXACTLY where the parody is coming from. An obviously offhand comment "You've got HAPPY FEET" or a casual complete zoom in to Rocky's iconic boxing shorts, reading "ROCKY" should do the trick nicely.

4. Make a list of obviously very funny things such as people repeatedly getting hurt (Yeah, repeated child abuse in Meet The Spartans is ever-so-funny) and be sure to drag it out AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. Use this philosophy with every unfunny gag in the film. AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. I'm talking at least 10 minutes of the same thing here.

5. Release as a film. It doesn't have to be funny in any way for it to make money.

Surely the world has gone downhill and died, its rotting remains appearing to be the very stuff this film is made of. Almost everything in the whole film that is parodied (and I use that term with as little discretion as possible) can be seen in the trailers, and even with the limited time in a trailer, it still sucks.

I think I need a drink.

review_title: Boycott this movie, for the good of the world
review_detailed_main:
I refused to see this movie for obvious reasons. To be fair, I rated it based on the trailer (a generous 1, give is zero IMDb!!) I didn't need to see any more than that. If you think that's narrow minded of me, well maybe you could fill me in on what happens?

I also voted it 1 in the hope that it might help stop such films being made. As Mark Kermode said this week "If you pay to go and see that kind of movie, it's your fault when they do it next time. It's a personal responsibility issue, there is no excuse." Perhaps some will say "No one's forcing you to see it, it's just a bit of fun." Well that's bull. There are thousands of incredible screenplays and supremely talented filmmakers out there, and only a finite amount of film capital to be had. Think of the dozen or so beautiful indie movies that could have been made with the budget used for this.

This kind of dross is cynical, depressing, bandwagon jumping studio zombie fodder. And judging by the trailers, about as funny as a cot death.

I really loved that movie and in my opinion the director really could beat the 300 movie which was a terrible mistake in the history of movie making. the guys in the movie played incredibly funny which had me and all of my friends in stitches. You have to watch it guys it shows that stupid Spartans with their freaky outfit which suits the fagots! try to fight the great Persian army and all they got is 13 stupid fagot dancers!!!! try to fight (dance)!!!! review_title: It isn't smart, it isn't witty, but that doesn't mean it's not funny
review_detailed_main:
I have to admit, I only saw this because I lost a coin toss with my friend when debating which movie to see. That said, I was pleasantly surprised. I actually laughed quite often. There were a lot of laughs, a lot of cultural spoofs, and everyone in the theater seemed to be having a great time.

It was exactly what I expected, a 300 spoof with cultural references to other movies and societies, only funnier. I hadn't liked Date Movie or Epic Movie, so I was skeptical. But I was quickly won over and found myself very entertained.

It's not intelligent humor, but still quite funny. It starts out good, gets better, than becomes actually really stupid, but overall, its a funny movie, and I recommend it if you like the "stupid humor" genre.

review_title: The absolute worst of film making, and dare i say it, human behaviour
review_detailed_main:
Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer. Never have i despised 2 individuals such as the discontent i have for both these unimaginative, humourless so called creative minds. How they continue to make movies is beyond me. They have just completed a hat trick with Meet The Spartans, that is, created 3 of the worst movies ever seen in a row. It's an incredible feat. Despite having a free ticket and being begged to attend with a friend (i have closed and terminated that friendship as a result), i still felt ripped off. Actually scrap that, i felt physically abused after viewing this. Stripped of any dignity.

And despite this, we still see users on IMDb that actually give this rating more than 1 star (I'd happily hack the website and change the code to allow a zero rating if i could). I'm not sure as to what the mindset is of a person that could find this utter drivel humorous. Perhaps they find the idea of referencing a movie without actually making it any funnier, or on occasions, actually changing the script as a comedic tool. If that fails, let's use gay jokes. If that fails, lets reference again and this time tell the audience what it is we are referencing just in case they didn't laugh the first time. I mean the lack of humour is quite staggering, it actually made me cringe. I think heard more laughs in the cinema whilst watching Requiem For A Dream.

I mean to call this movie a spoof is a complete and utter insult to the likes of Airplane! and Spaceballs. In fact, its an insult to the country of America that such a movie could be released. The fact that it made something like $18 million in its opening week perhaps give us an insight as to why America is the focus of terrorism. Perhaps these sources of terror were exposed to the films of Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer.

Refusing to spend any money to see this movie, I had to wait nearly 3 years until it premiered on TV. Seeing as this had made it to the infamous Bottom 100, I sadly consider this movie to actually be a useful tool for calibrating one's rating scale. But *only* for that purpose, not for entertainment. Truly, they don't come any worse than this.

Even at 84 minutes, this movie struggles to fill its runtime. When the "parody" of 300 is over and the end credits start running, this is still barely over 70 minutes, so they add all the alternate and abandoned scenes to the end! These clunkers are so bad I cannot even imagine what horrors they have included as DVD/Blu-ray extras...

One always hears the words "I did not laugh a single time during that load of crap", but most often even a terrible movie elicits at least one laugh from the viewer. Now I have seen a movie during which I truly did not laugh even a single time. I did not even smile. At best, my mouth may have twitched once, but it might have been a muscle spasm.

The makers of these movies should learn one simple lesson since they obviously cannot be *prevented* from making them in the first place: do NOT attempt to make parodies of money shot scenes that in the original movies cost millions of dollars. Your "parody" will only become even more embarrassing than it already is. I feel pity for the technical crew, whose talent was wasted on this - obviously this was done so fast and cheap that the producers couldn't afford to pay them do spend the required time to do their work properly. Even the few talented actors who appear here seem to have been "directed" to act their scenes only once - which is kinda ironic, considering the "writing" is so bad, an infinite amount of takes would not have improved the end result.

Bottom line: *Believe* IMDb. This 1/10 movie should be buried into the crust of the Earth. Anyone who likes this is out of their mind. Yes, I really mean that. Argument on the "merits" of this movie if you like, it will only make you a bigger fool than you already are.

this group of movies is getting worse and worse, scary movie was decent, Spartans was horrible. my little brother cried until i agreed to go with him, i sat through this masterpiece wondering how they keep getting the funding to make more of these!! after i was tricked into going to epic movie by their deceivingly entertaining commercials, i vowed to never see another movie from the series, but i was forced to go, i had low expectations going in and even i was surprised by how bad it was, i was actually ANGRY!!! the only parts i liked were the ones where Carmen Electra was dancing or lying around nearly naked ha ha, so if that's all you're looking for, then you might like thins, but if you go to movies to actually be entertained and not be ashamed to mention that you went to it, this is definitely not for you. as for me, i am going to forget i ever went to this piece of crap and never tell anyone!!!

review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen.......it made me feel sad >:'(
This film made me feel dirty.
review_detailed_main:
Shameful, absolutely shameful; shockingly unfunny, embarrassingly awful; I cannot put this film down far enough. The gags come thick and fast, the problem is they're simply not funny. I didn't go and see this film out of choice and fortunately for me, I didn't pay to see it. If I had, I'd have demanded a refund. This is quite possibly one of the worst films ever made and the shameful advertising of several well known products within the film made me feel sick.

The "actors," and I use the term loosely, are in my opinion nothing more than mere whores as it seems to me they will do anything for money. To stoop so low as to appear in a howler like this, removes any shred of credibility they may have had (that's assuming they had any in the first place).

Do yourselves a favour and stay away from this turkey. And if in the future, any more of these films are made by the same company, stay away from them too as I'll willingly wager they'll be no better.

review_title: The only thing worse than a Chevy Chase movie...
review_detailed_main:
I was expecting at least Naked Gun laughs out of this movie, I guess I raised the bar too "high". My god, is this movie horrible.

The worst thing is all the pop-culture jokes, I mean spoofing reality shows and t.v. commercials is not that funny. At least with Scary Movie or the like you get something that can make you laugh at least once. This movie is just lame.

Some of the incredibly unfunny scenes just go on forever. That really takes the wind out of already lame jokes.

If someone drags you to this film, take a pillow with you... at least then you won't waste your time.

Even posting a review is a waste of time for a movie that bad... It's hard to write ten lines about something that stupid.. Well then:

The pathetic part is that they still find actors doing those movies. Do they actually get paid for that or do they read the script if there was one? I mean, I was going to ask for a refund on my way out. I normally don't complain about movies because at the end it's my decision to see them this one you shouldn't even call a movie.

Just do yourself a favor and don't watch it!!!

WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!!

Enough said!

I actually watched this movie thinking that most people here on IMDb were just jumping on the 'this movie sucks' bandwagon and that it couldn't be as bad as people claimed it was.

There is absolutely NO comedy in this movie whatsoever.. it's just pure and pure nonsense that could only make 3-year olds laugh. Scenes are stretched out FAR too long and that would be OK if they were fun or interesting but it's just boredom.

I do not remember myself laughing once during this movie. I could not even manage to get off an innocent smile. It's just horrible.

I'd say the only good thing about this movie would be Carmen Electra but since there are 'interesting' pics of her all over the internet that's a minus as well.

DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE!

My best friend and I usually pride ourselves in being rather intelligent. We've seen some very good movies from different genres recently ("Charlie Wilson's War, "P.S. I Love You", and "Atonement"), but this movie left us gasping for air. Sometimes it's nice to let your hair down, put aside intelligent thought for an hour and a half, and enjoy some stupid humor. I'd say that we didn't go more than two minutes without laughing at something. There's a lot of pop culture references, and as long as you don't take it too seriously they're quite funny. If you're easily offended do not go see this movie! However, if you're capable of loosening up and laughing unabashedly at idiotic humor you'll have fun. P.S. If you stay until the very end of the credits there's one last little spoof that's pretty well-placed (considering that it features a character from a movie currently in theatres).

review_title: OMG - You call this a MOVIE?

review_detailed_main: It's a movie which will have you think a million things when your viewing it, you might think "i wonder who might find this funny", "what age group is this aimed at". Stay away. 0 / 10.

review_title: The Worst of all Spoof Movies!!!
review_detailed_main: I went to this movie expecting it to be fairly stupid, but I had no idea it would be this bad. I thought it was written by the guys who wrote Scary Movie because those movies are at least worth seeing. Yet, then I found out that it was written by the two guys who wrote Date Movie. I previously thought that it was not possible to make a spoof movie worse than Date Movie but I was proved wrong. Those two should be banned from making movies! The first ten minutes were actually pretty funny so i guess it wasn't all bad but after those ten minutes it was absolutely awful! I remember when spoof movies actually tied all the movies that they were making fun of together in a smart way. They just took movies and threw them in as stupidly as they possible could. It brings shame to the movie 300. It was the only movie that I've ever seen in theaters when I seriously thought about leaving. This movie was probably written in a day. If you have more than an I.Q. of .1 then do not see this film! If I could physically kill this movie I would. I think i got my point across.

I love spoof movies, they always bring a smile to my face. Of course, they are always bad, but in a sense I can live with. When I saw that this film (which had an idea I immediately thought was a good one) was in the bottom #100, I was quite surprised.

And having seen it (and read the reviews here) I am surprised again. I laughed a lot during this movie, from the Shrek baby to the "I will survive"-scene at the end. It was just the typical spoof movie to me and I fail to see why this would be so much worse than, for example, Scary Movie 1-4.

The TV-show spoofs were too much for me, but seeing Britney (and George Bush in the extra scenes) getting kicked into the Pit of Death... I liked it! :-) I might have weird humour, though. Never thought my opinion would differ so much from 98% of the reviews here.

I gave it a 5 out of 10 and I was considering a 6.

review_title: Better than the last bunch of spoof films but still not enough jokes to justify paying to see in theaters I'd wait for cable.
This movie isn't even bad enough to let you to laugh at how bad it is.

review_detailed_main: I can usually find something redeeming in almost any movie. I was anticipating something like Scary Movie, Joe Dirt, or any one of Will Farrel's flicks. You know, a movie so stupid it's funny. HOWEVER, this movie was so stupid it was just, well stupid, bordering on complete irritation. There were a number of kids in the theater and I can't say that I heard a single one laugh. A movie that is supposed to be funny and can't get a twelve year old to even giggle is pretty sad. I've never felt so compelled to walk from the theater before a film was over. It really is that bad. With so many great movies that go straight to DVD, I wonder how this one made it to the big screen.

review_title: I absolutely loved it! Don't waste time reading my review, go rent it!!

I try not to judge movies by my own opinion, i try to see what other people might think of this movie. Just because i loved it doesn't mean its really good and everything, I'm just saying, if you have a stupid sense of humor like me, go rent it or something because its awesome.

review_title: Good movie if you want to laugh.

review_detailed_main: This movie will guarantee make you laugh, but its not usually like the other scary movies, date movie, etc it only imitates 1 movie which is "300" In what the trailers you see, you will not see lots of the clips like the spider man shown and Rambo. This movie has the same plot as 300 which is receiving a message from the messenger and and having several battles against xeroxes army, in much in a more humor way. Although instead of REAL battles, they have a break dance and stomp competition and mom jokes, Through out the movie you will see judges just like American idol, only when the Spartans has competitions/battles, It has good quality I don't want to spoil too much, so ill just say 1 thing, the ending would of been better cause they over done it with the result of the Spartans death oh and 1 more thing, its only ONE HOUR LONG! just 60 minutes i still recommend you guys to watch it

It's a spoof of 300...in case you didn't know. Another run of the mill spoof movie that all these people are putting out lately.

Yeah we can all admit that spoof movies are generally AWFUL...this one isn't an exception. I just hate that people take these moves so seriously. They try to often than not to point out mistakes and things like that. People like this (no offense) do not need to watch these sorts of movies. 'Meet the Spartans' has a couple of good chuckles, but it is a spoof...so don't expect much more than that.

If you like a spoof movie then watch it....if you are expecting something else, don't waste your time.

Actually I saw this film (against my will) and as the trailers did not look funny (trailers show casing a movies best set ups) then logic dictates this movie will be as bad as the Comebacks- but I was able to sit through the whole thing and did not feel completely ripped off- even the credits offered some of the better laughs. Now I must agree that the creators decided to explain every premise of every punchline leading me to believe they wrote this thing with morons in mind but a couple of the bits (the different greetings for men and women Spartans) will hold up through the years. Many segments will not hold up as they used a lot of modern culture shock news for parody- like the little freak crying about Brittney (does anyone find him funny?? now let alone 10 years from now) In fact too often the film takes a bad joke and beats it into the ground as in the Stomp the yard/ You've been Served parody.

Many actors were from Mad T.V. rehashing their impersonations of celebrities and did a wonderful job in almost every scene. The problem really was the script needed a Babaloo Mandel to tighten it up. I can't say it is worth full admission but it was not the total waste of time I thought it was going to be.

review_title: So what did I just watch?

review_detailed_main:
1. Worst 2. Awful 3. Nauseating

This movie has no excuse in the world. I wonder why Lionsgate even think of giving them the money to do what secondary school children can do better. A school stage play I once saw was even better than this, even when the backdrop fell over their heads and half of them cried. The jokes are so stale. One can tell a joke once or twice and it still can be funny but after the 7th time it gets annoying. Maybe the reason why this movie dwells so much on one gag (albeit not a funny one, e.g. the dance-off, the deathly kick to the pits - all 53 of them, the game show references etc...) is because the set was so elaborately and painstakingly built, (and the dancers were so highly paid) they were trying so hard to milk every single lame gag they could think of and make full use (or abuse) of it. This movie has no particular direction, other than the one from the original movie, and definitely requires no talent whatsoever to make and I won't be surprised Friedberg and Seltzer would re-spoof this movie again given the chance. (It's probably in post-production...).

If you think this is a good film, then you must be idiotic! There are crude jokes, with a little laugh, advertisements, everything is flawed! Aaron Seltzer: I have one word for you: Refresh! Refreshing is a good way to make your career pop up again, but this is one huge piece of s**t! You make awful sequels like Smokey and the Bandit 3 and Robocop 3 look like blockbuster hits because of you! Aaron Seltzer: You are pathetic. Unless you come up with a better idea even more than your latest film, I've seen enough.

Comedy: 1/10 Spoof: 1/10 Success: 1/10 Creativity: 1/10

Overall: an F--- (1/10).

review_title: Well, in all honesty it was better than any other Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer directed movie I've seen so far.
review_detailed_main:
Yes, amazingly enough I have to conclude that this was the best Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer directed movie I've seen in my entire life. It doesn't mean that this movie is exactly brilliant though. It's incredibly lame, features embarrassingly bad and unfunny moments and is basically a movie purely made to cash in.

Simple fact is that as long as these movies are making money, more like them will likely get made and released. And this movies are making big money. Every time a Friedberg/Selzer parody gets released I see it somewhere in the top of the box office lists. I really don't understand this. Don't people by now know who Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are and what type of movies they make? I'm never telling people to boycott movies or film-making but now I'm simply begging everyone to stop and pay money to see these type of movies, it's the only way we can stop them from being produced. Power to the people! Yes, I know I'm also still watching these movies, so I probably look guilty as well but at least I'm not paying any money for it to do so.

The movie is titled "Meet the Spartans", so yes it indeed is mostly a spoof of the movie "300" and it follows basically the same plot line and type of characters but as you could expect from a Friedberg/Selzer the movie is spoofing tons of other recent successful movies as well, as well as some famous movie and TV celebrities. Like always the movie is bombarding us with this. Joke after joke is being put in the movie, as if they were thinking lets put in as many comical moments as possible and some of them are just bound to hit. I must admit, some jokes do hit and is the reason why I regard this movie as the best one from Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer but unfortunately it's only about 5% of the jokes and comical moments that do hit and made me laugh. 95% of the rest of the movie is just an utter waste of time and insulting to anyone's intelligence. No, there is nothing wrong with some silly comedy from time to time but not when it is as embarrassingly bad as is the case with "Meet The Spartans" and every other Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer movie for that matter.

But I always have to give this movie credit for one thing; it's always good and professionally looking. There is still obviously some money and effort put into this movie and it has a good visual look over it. What it also does well is re-playing some of the well known sequences from "300". I'll guess you'll probably hate this movie less if you've seen "300" and most of the other movies that are being spoofed within this movie.

Also most of the actors do a decent job impersonating the actors from "300". Of course most characters are just totally bad and lame though but I don't think you can blame the actors for this. I think it was also a good choice to give Carmen Electra a much bigger role this time because lets face it, her appearances basically always had been part of the highlights of any other Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer movie. Also quite fun that Kevin Sorbo has a big part in the movie. He is of course best known for playing Hercules in the hit-series and TV movies. So he's perfectly in place in this movie, despite the fact that he already was 50 at the time of this movie.

For what it's worth; it's better than any other Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer movie I've seen before in my life. It doesn't mean this movie is watchable or recommendable though. Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer made lame and bad comedy spoofs in the past and they will also just never become good at it. Please simply boycott their next movies when it will hit the cinema and you'll help to prevent these types of movies from being made and you'll stop unfunny and untalented people such as Friedberg and Seltzer from ever making a movie again. Thank you very much!

3/10

review_title: Worth seeing for anyone without a stick shoved up their ass...
review_detailed_main: Although this movie does have negative reviews, I'd like to point out that those select reviewers most certainly have a something shoved up their ass. For one, anyone who is going to see this movie should know from the previews, and simply from the name of the film, that this is a parody movie. If you strenuously hate the Date movies, Scary movies or the Epic Movie then what are you doing watching this film? 'Meet The Spartans' is a film that is obviously marketed towards teenagers, and it delivers well to this said group. I actually watched this movie twice, both times the cinema was packed with teens, and everyone was laughing throughout the movie. Memorable scenes, ranging from clever 'Yo Mama' jokes to Britney Spears (She is a joke, yes?) do make this movie worthwhile. There is no great cinematography in the film, but that's hardly expected. All in all, I believe this is a good movie to see if you're looking for a laugh-- it's something you would see with friends for a good time out.

i don't understand why all you guys are so mad with this movie? i didn't expect to see anything serious in this movie, it's all for gags and fun, and it's quite funny that it joked all those new movies and even Paris Hilton, i laughed numerous times and i enjoyed it. especially for the 007 scene, it was quite a surprise to see Leonidas got his ball hit and bite by a dog, that was really a lmao!

the story plot was not creative, except from those funny crossovers, there's nothing new for the story as it simply copied 300, everything was expected, made me a bit boring though, it would be better if it creates a new story like scary movies series. if the plot wasn't so original i would give a 8.

I've reviewed close to 3,000 movies in my lifetime and I've never seen anything like this....and that's not a good thing. This can't even really be considered a spoof. There's no imagination to it. They just stole the storyline from "300," added a ton of really lame pop culture references, a bunch of ridiculous product placement (which probably paid for the movie), and dialogue involving other movies, you get this stinking pile of putrid waste! Plus, I don't want to be told about every joke seconds before it happens! Why do they allow crap like this in theaters?! I'm sure they could make a movie out of better scripts than this! They didn't even have the decency to try and change the names to make them funny! I hated "Epic Movie" (I rated it the #1 worst movie of 2007), but at least I chuckled once, when Crispin Glover as the psychotic Willy Wonka. You know how many times I laughed at this movie? Zero. Not a single smirk. I didn't even smile. This isn't just the worst comedy of the year (I realize the year's not over, but there's no way in hell in can get any worse than this), it's the worst comedy of all time. If I had to choose between watching paint peel or viewing this steaming load of monkey butt waste, bring on the peeling paint! This must be what the government uses for torture, because it was certainly torture watching it.

review_title: The pits...trashy spoof of "300" deserved winning five Razzies...
review_detailed_main:
The only redeeming thing about MEET THE SPARTANS is that a few members of the cast really show signs of talent--and yes, I'm talking about Sean Maguire, Kevin Sorbo and Travis Van Winkle, three of the more prominent hunks in leather outfits. Sean has the principal role as Leonidas (immortalized by Gerard Butler in "300"), and all three of them show a grasp of comic delivery with a silly line along with their impressive physiques.

But the script is a total mess, inserting pop culture jokes and celebrities into many a moment in a grab for laughs, with only a few of them hitting the mark. The sets aren't that bad and the costuming is what you'd expect in this kind of spoof.

Carmen Electra walks through her role in such a stiff manner, she makes Maria Montez (of the '40s Sabu films) look like a thespian. The jokes are flat, the dialog is sophomoric and the whole mess is punishment to sit through after the first fifteen minutes.

There are movies which have some kind of value in them. This movie is just NOT one of these. I understand that they wanted to create a funny spoof movie from a low budget but they totally failed. The whole movie is like 1 hour long, full of mind-killing, pathetic flicks which made me think they made it this bad on purpose. To tell you the truth, I couldn't finish it because it was getting more and more annoying and I couldn't stand it.

I wanted to rate this film to 0 / 10 or even -1 / 10 but it's not possible so I had to give it 1/10 (awful)...

If you don't want to cry on pathetic jokes, avoid this film.
