review_title: Light and amusing enough, far better than its source material
review_detailed_main:
The Frank Miller-penned disaster 300 provided the backdrop to many ignorant comments about a thoroughly inaccurate and outright insulting portrayal of the Spartans; as a folklorist and lifelong enthusiast of classical mythology and legend, as well as having an interest in the actual history of the event (or as much as can be determined from what remains), I was appalled not only by the flagrant disregard for even the spirit of the events. But I wasn't surprised. After all, it was Frank Miller. It shouldn't surprise me that 300 was a horrific, homophobic, historically-inaccurate abomination.

Then came Meet the Spartans, which admittedly is limited by its source material -- the film 300, along with numerous references to popular culture -- but is amusing enough to pass the time. While it is also brought down by a rather short running time, and a few jokes that hit or miss, the ones that hit are amusing enough to carry through the ones that don't. It's also, ironically, closer to the spirit of the story, despite its silly jokes, than 300 could ever hope to be, with its testosterone-laden homophobia and self-important pretension evident at each and every turn. Meet the Spartans takes all the best instances of that and turns them into wicked comedy, which works as well as it does because of the generally talented cast and amusing setup.

That's not to say that everything works equally well. 300 doesn't really give much to work with, and they do manage to parody everything that they can. But some of the things used to fill the time between moments is too dependent on pop culture references, and these aren't always as funny as they could be. Additionally they may not age well, and at some point down the line people may watch this and wonder why certain stretches are actually supposed to be funny, or what they refer to in their many celebrity imitations and so forth.

The downbeat ending, unfortunately too-closely mirroring 300's own, also started to wind down the film and wasn't able to pick it up until a hilariously outrageous sequence during the credits, which do pick up the mood considerably and had me laughing again before I knew it.

Overall, however, this blows 300 and other equally pretentious and overblown films out of the water. It's certainly fun for a casual viewing, and the extras on the DVD really make it worth picking up, because there's a lot of them, and they're enjoyable. This isn't really some kind of deeply intellectual fare, naturally, but it's a lot of fun if one approaches it with the mindset that it's just simple, mindless fun -- something 300 should've been, but wasn't even close to being, and instead it tried to be some kind of historical put-on. Meet the Spartans wisely eschews the pretension and just unabashedly brings on relentless silliness, and in my opinion it's certainly enjoyable enough for a rental, if nothing else.

showing Xerxes like this its nothing except dishonor to Persian culture. Xerxes was son of Darius the Great of Persia and Atossa, the daughter of Cyrus the Great. After his accession in October 485 BC, he suppressed the revolts in Egypt and Babylon that had broken out the year before and appointed his brother Achaemenes as governor or satrap over Egypt (Old Persian: khshathrapavan). In 484 BC, he took away from Babylon the golden statue of Bel (Marduk, Merodach), the hands of which the legitimate king of Babylon had to seize on the first day of each year, and killed the priest who tried to hinder him. Therefore Xerxes does not bear the title of King in the Babylonian documents dated from his reign, but King of Persia and Media or simply King of countries (i.e. of the world). This proceeding led to two rebellions, probably in 484 BC and 479 BC. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xerxes_I_of_Persia

review_title: Behold the worst film ever made. The Spartans would make short work of them.
review_detailed_main:
Well if were being honest what did you expect? Did you guys expect this to be any better than Date movie or even Epic Movie? No meet the Spartans manages to be significantly worse than both of those films combined. Parodying epic films 300, Transformers and err Happy Feet? This is only for those who are deeply dedicated to this long dead series and car crash cinema enthusiasts.

I don't know how my brain allowed me to see this picture. I thought it would be like trying to suffocate yourself; your body would just shut down before you could do it. Apparently I was wrong. I sat through this movie and laughed once, and that was during the preview for another movie. There was the odd part where I might have cracked a smile or thought, "This might be funny if..." but there is a very good reason for that. Instead of making good jokes and thoughtful humor, the writers decided to just constantly send an endless stream of jokes at you and hoped one of them made you chuckle.

From the creators of Scary Movie and Date Movie comes this tongue-in-cheek parody of the sword-and-sandal epics, dubbed Meet the Spartans. The 20th Century Fox production was written and directed by the film-making team of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

Sure, Leonidas may have nothing more than a cape and some leather underwear to protect him from the razor-sharp swords of his Persian enemies, but that won't stop the brave leader and his team of 13 warriors from defending their beloved homeland against a powerful invading force that includes the likes of a mutant Paris Hilton, the Transformers, the Ghost Rider, and Rocky Balboa.

The much-discussed homo eroticism of Snyder's epic predictably is played for laughs here. (The Spartans are a campy group of guys who march -- or, more precisely, skip -- to a disco beat.) But after the 10th or 20th repetition of a gag about Leonidas' leather underpants and the other scantily-clad Spartans -- a gag that isn't terribly funny the first time -- even the more virulent homophobes in the audience likely will respond with groans, not giggles.

The unmistakable air of desperation hangs heavily over the entire production, as the filmmakers repeatedly resort to introducing celebrity lookalikes -- doubles for Britney Spears, Tom Cruise, George Bush, the cast of "American Idol" -- as nothing more than walking-and-talking punch lines.

It's reflective of the pic's insubstantially and slapdash construction that, shortly after the closing credits begin to roll at the 65-minute mark, the filmmakers introduce deleted scenes -- not outtakes but snippets obviously trimmed in the editing room -- without any regard for continuity or coherence. It's as though they figured that, what the hell, they went to the trouble and expense of shooting this stuff, and, by God, they were going to use it.

My final Verdict? Avoid at all costs. Meet the Spartans is probably the worst film ever made.

review_title: a fantastic rape of the spartans, humour and all film

Anyway i didn't really see a plot to the film, mainly stabs at celebrities, stabs that are constant, unfunny and unsurprisingly predictable. This is all performed (i use that word loosely) under the guise of Spartans, who most people believe to be half naked bodybuilders who shout a lot. AS much as i hated the attempts at humour and the fact that this is classed as a comedy, what i hate the most is that the stupid people who enjoyed this probably believe that the spartans were really like the way they're portrayed in this "film" or in 300 for that matter. After the film i was confused, how can films like "there will be blood" and "american gangster" be made in the same country and year as this piece of sickening humourless rubbish.

This movie seriously depressed me. Epic movie gave me a few laughs, dismal as it was, Date Movie made me giggle a bit, && even The Scary Movies were something of a riot. But this...this one was terrible, even for the series' standards.

The Stomp the Yard spoof was entirely too long. It was only funny for about the first ten seconds. After that it was awkward, because you knew you were suppose to be laughing, but it just wasn't funny.

The pit of death was the only truly funny bit, for me. But the constant reference to popular TV reality shows quickly became tiresome. They weren't original or funny.

This movie wasn't good at all, not by any standards. I went to this movie hoping to be laughing the whole time, but instead I was wishing I had better invested my $7.

review_title: not even as good as some classic turkeys
review_detailed_main:
The films of Ed Wood have been used as a standard to show how bad movies can be. Their plots didn't make much sense, the acting was terrible, their lack of production values was the lowest around, but they did have a sense of dignity about them. They tried to be the best they could be and were horrible anyway.

Meet the Spartans fails on so many different grounds, the real question that needed to be asked was who gave this movie a green light in the first place and why is this person still working in Hollywood? A SNL skit of about two minutes might have been the end result and we might have forgiven them for it, since at least on SNL they try new things.

While I only spent $3 on my ticket, I feel like they need to pay me back for the time they took away from my movie life. I've seen offensive movies before and there is usually a point to be made, here the only point is "I've got you ticket money and what will you do about it." I am ashamed for those actors who with this on their credits may never get another acting role again in their lives, why risk something like this? I really hope that the producers/writers/ and actors for this dreck will offer an apology to the film community for this. Ed Wood is now not at the bottom of the heap when it comes to making films.

This movie was excellent! I strongly suggest to see it. The content wasn't that bad, it was just very funny. Even if you like what they are making fun of, it is still hilarious. I liked almost everything they made fun of but i still loved the movie. I am so going to buy it when it comes out on DVD. So if your looking to see a movie this one is great! The movie is only rated p g 13 and there is mostly just crude humor, but even at that its not bad. All you really pay attention to is the comedy in it. Im thinking about taking a lot of my friends to see it, i think they would like it. If you like movies like scary movie 1, 2, 3, and 4, or epic movie, you would definitely enjoy this movie, everyone I know that saw it liked it a lot! It is a great movie!

I like my comedies stupid, "Meet the Spartans" more than delivers. It makes no bones about being a parody of all and everything the filmmakers could think of. Mostly it pokes juvenile fun at the excellent but highly stylized "300". Here Leonidas, played to the hilt by Sean McGuire, leads a rag-tag bunch of 13, thats right 13!, Spartans against insurmountable Persians.

But who cares? It's the sight gags and corny humor we all tuned in for! McGuire is added by Kevin Sorbo of Hercules fame as his captain. Sorbo is so good here, why doesn't this guy get more good roles? Carmen Electra, naturally, is on hand to lend some sex appeal. Nicole PAker of MAd TV plays no less than five roles and if you don't laugh and her dead-on Paula Abdul imitation there's something wrong with you.

I laughed out loud at most of this blissfully short spoof, but my favorite sequence was the rank session with the hi-hop Persians. Funny! Lines like, "Your Momma is such a sloppy drunk, I thought she was David Hasslehoff!" are just righteously funny. Deidrich Bader is a hoot as Traitorus, Get it? and the rather obvious jokes about the Spartans latent homosexuality are so dead-on that you have to laugh, love the Budweiser parody!!

Meet the Spartans ain't Shakespeare folks, its not supposed to be. Sure it could have been better, but its right up there with Epic Movie and Not Antoher Teen Movie as very funny. Plus guys there is one outrageous shot of Queen Margo (Carmen) that you have to see to believe! I mean my jaw hit to floor!

This is just a funny spoof start to finish and stay tuned through the credits, some of the funniest stuff is there! Oh, if you were worried they'd change the end to make Leonidas and his compatriots victorious have no fear! They're too stupid to win!

review_title: Meet the Spartans- Not Good or Bad, Just Mediocre
review_detailed_main:
People are bashing this movie to bits. But to some of us (myself included) thought it was good. There were funny parts and there were so-insulting-it's-not-funny parts. Here is my review for Meet The Spartans:

Plot: All you need to know is that this is a parody of 300 (the main plot) with movies like Spider-Man 3, Ghost Rider and Transformers (for which I've written a review already). Show parodies of American Idol and other parodies like You Tube are in here too. There are funny parts to it, but not a lot of them-7/10

Cast: There are a few familiar faces in this movie- Carmen Electra (Epic Movie, Cheaper by the dozen 2, etc.) and Ken Davitian (Borat no less). Other then that, the cast is pretty much new to movies, but do a good job nonetheless- 6/10

Jokes: Because there's not enough SFX in this movie, I'm replacing it with jokes. You see, there were good jokes (the Bond scene, the blue screen gag, the GTA Parody, I will survive and a couple more) Jokes that didn't make too much sense, but were good nevertheless (the opening scene, The yo mama fight, Xerxestron and a few others) and some, just plain bad altogether (the deleted scenes, the Mumble/Leonidas fight, the ending *excluding the song that is* and the trailers before the movie *well duh* among others)- 8/10

Overall: I liked this movie, the cast did their best. the jokes kept coming (although some didn't make sense or were pretty bad). But overall, It ended up as mediocre- 6/10

Another review by Phil MacRae- This...Is...IMDb!

Meet The Spartans not only proves that you can still go lower from Epic Movie, it also makes you wonder who is to blame. Someone paid to see this film, despite having seen the advertisements. Someone believed spending money in a collection of awful jokes and what might have been called pop culture references if they had any depth was the right thing to do. If you walked up to a random child and asked him/her to write a short summary for an original movie script, you'd get better results than Meet The Spartans.

It is just that bad. Do everyone a favor, do not support the makers of this movie. Do not see it, buy it or rent it. Forget it even exists.

Meet The Spartans is a new low for the American film industry.

300 was an excellent film. Meet the Spartans was the perfect insult to the film.

As it is a parody film, it can be cut some slack with regards to the plot. However 90% of the 'jokes' were pop-culture references or parodies of films other than "Three Hundred".

Several times over the course of the film, jokes were repeated over and over again in slightly different styles when in essence being the same old thing.

One good use of this film is for interrogation rooms. Sit the victim in front of an IMAX screen and play this movie. You'll have them begging for mercy within seconds.

review_title: I give this movie a big "Swords Down"
review_detailed_main: The film genre of "movie parodies" is really in the toilet. Every gag and bit in this movie dragged out way too long. Had I known how much sewage was going to be on display, I would have never taken my 7th Grader to this mess. I had thought about not taking her, but she pestered me for 2 weeks to go on opening night. Plus she had a friend with her. This is a PG-13 rated movie that should have been rated R. I sat in anothe row with my girlfriend and was really squirming in my seat the entire time. It is full of homosexual jokes from beginning to end and they weighed the movie down beyond description. Carmen Electra was abysmal and I pray to God that I never have to see that fat guy from "Borat" scantily clad ever again. It's just overkill. There was also enough product placement that the producers probably were able to raise the entire budget from corporate sponsorship. I am convinced that we are in full decline as a civilization if this is the idea of humor in the minds of our youth. Don't waste your time with this stink bomb.

review_title: You will understand "madness" if you see this
I wish this movie would stop with the jokes and go on with the story
review_detailed_main:
I saw this movie when it came out but couldn't remember much about it (that's how little impression i made on me) so I saw it once more for my little IMDb bottom 100 project. I can start off by saying, it is really not worth seeing again; not only is it bad in it's own right, but my God has it aged badly. Many of the references that might have worked back then were just old and tired this time around - and that was only two years ago.

Like I said, this film doesn't just suffers from being dated, it just suffers, period. It has been so crammed full of unfunny, vulgar jokes that repeat in absurdum, that I often found myself wishing they would just stop being "funny" and continue with what little plot there was. Naturally, being a spoof that more or less just rips off the original, it has no plot of it's own, it just relies on those jokes, and that's where it FAILS. That's a good way to sum this up, Meet the Spartans is a huge failure of spoof movie.

I absolutely love parody. It's my favorite genre. From Spaceballs to Airplane!, I love watching them.

To such a fan of classic parody, this film is a kick in the balls.

This film is not only unfunny, it is the opposite of anything even remotely funny. I honestly think it's fun to watch bad films, but there is nothing fun about this piece of crap. It is my all time least favorite film. The film starts with the only part of the film you might be able smile at, with a few jokes. From there the film is riddled with unclever sex jokes and pop culture references that already aren't funny, and will make absolutely no since a few years down the road. I've seen Friedberg and Seltzer's other big film, Epic Movie, and didn't really like it. But where that film seemed like trying and failing, this film just seemed like they has given up trying to be clever. I would avoid this movie at all cost.

review_title: Low Brow Humor - six packs all around
review_detailed_main:
This is as low as you can go. You have to be in the mood to watch this. It is ridiculous and that is putting it mildly. But I reckon rewatching this, I kind of was in the right mood - sort of. On the other hand I have to rewatch 300 again. I remember how much I loved that movie.

This is sort of a spoof on that - but it does include a lot more than that. You have a lot of stars of the moment and things that made sense back then (like a viral video of someone crying over Brittney Spears - if you know, you know). And yes you can say that the movie 300 (based on the comic, which was based on something historical) is not believable either. But it did not have cars or GTA references or dance battles for that matter.

The main actor here (playing Leonidas), does a really good job. The movie itself however seems to be mean to a lot of things. You have to be in tune with the comedy this promotes ... there is also a lot of things that can be called offensive and something "...phobic" (you can pick and choose yourself). But again, it is up to you to rate how offended you want to be with this ... for its quality or for the content of the "jokes".

Most of Greek or Hellenistic culture is about slavery, homosexuality, fascism, racism and hate for all other cultures. The thing i found most funny is that i seen very angry Greeks around the Internet cursing Americans for making this movie, calling them all kinds of things. Wonder how American Greek lovers like makers of 300 feel about that. Anyone who actually possess a working brain will laugh a lot seeing this movie.

review_title: Meet the Spartans -better than the material it's spoofing-most of the time.
review_detailed_main:
Meet the Spartans may be silly and stupid but it is a spoof after all. I laughed out loud repeatedly when I saw it last week On Demand. OK-it was free and the price was right. It's a spoof of the movie 300. saying it had no plot is nonsense. It actually follows the movie from beginning to end. I've watched 300 3 x now and MTS 3+ x. On the whole,MTS was the better movie. I could have done without the defecating penguin and the general use of body fluids for laughs from the first shot of the the baby Leonides(who did look a lot like a baby Shrek) to the Pit of Doom to Xerxes (who's body jewelry I thought was over the top-till I saw 300!)and the training of the small boys( which again struck me as too harsh-till I saw 300.) All in all,this reminded me of SNL spoofing S. Palin. The lines were already there. So was the plot. If you didn't like the spoof,maybe you should take a more critical look at the original.

So here I am -it's July 18,2009. I have watched the movie 5 times-at least. As soon as I get around to it ,I will buy a copy.It's fandamdtastic. I read ALL the comments. SHAME one your closed little minds. I don't usually waste much time on spoofs but this was a worthy one. I watched it in isolation. I watched after having seen its model. Best of all,I watched the 2 movies back to back. Wow! The 300 was pretentious crap. Really. But Meet The Spartans made it forever,memorable pretentious crap.I especially love the spray-on six packs and the dancing and skipping.But then I have a superb sense of humour and just love the snark. As for the child abuse? It's actually a pretty broad depiction of what happens in 300. So maybe you should watch closer.

review_title: This is the best worst movie I've ever seen

review_detailed_main: The only reason I give it more stars than one is because the costuming was pretty competent. This is a prime example of the 2000s parody film genre pioneered by the Seltzerberg duo - juvenile, tasteless and braindead.

review_title: There's a reason why I broke the DVD I borrowed back in 2010.
review_detailed_main: And that was from a video store! I know that such places should never have existed considering the prevalence of piracy when this was released, but there were. review_title: Meet The Spartans kicked Britney Spears, Paris Hilton and my soul into a deep, dark pit of death...300 times.
review_detailed_main:
"This is just a cheap spoof of that '300' film". That, right there, is a literal quote from this coma-inducing parody. An abomination that believes itself to be so self-aware, that it has transcended comedy as an entire genre. No, seriously. Friedberg and Seltzer fully acknowledge how low they have stooped, just for one measly laugh from a societal degenerate watching this in the hope they are experiencing a future masterpiece.

Within the first whole minute of runtime, baby Shrek vomits on a peasant and is subsequently kicked down a cliff, abandoned to die for its deformity. A Vietnamese child is then gently put on display for "Brangelina" to waltz on over and adopt the youngling, seemingly mocking their generous intents as doting parents. And then Leonidas, with a fully grown beard at the age of one, is accepted as a Spartan. But to become king, he must endure brutal training in order to hunt down (wait for it...) "gangsta penguin". Essentially 'Happy Feet' with a black man's attitude. Years later Carmen Electra erotically dances, objecting herself and women in general for all those white nerdy virgins who want to bash one out in front of the screen, and a messenger from Xerxes wanders across. He is taught the gender greetings within Sparta. High fives for the ladies, and open mouthed kissing with tongues for the gents. Aren't gay jokes absolutely frickin' hilarious? Blah blah blah, Leonidas shouts the famous line and kicks the messenger down a badly visualised pit. Along with Britney Spears during her mid-life crisis shaving moment, the panel from 'American Idol' and some other singer who doesn't ring any bells with me whatsoever.

Ladies and gentlemen, that's all you need to know about Meet The Spartans. Just a montage of celebrity re-enactments, American game/talent shows, a plethora of "spoofs" from unrelated films released in '07 and a bunch of actors destroying the flimsy remains that they call "careers". Sexual exploitation, homophobic slurs and borderline racism round off the "humour" that opts to gross viewers out instead of injecting some stimulating hilarity. So yeah, no thanks. The irony in all this, is that this isn't the worst parody feature from these directors! Mind-boggling to say the least. Oh, and Lindsay Lohan predictably gets mocked once again...

I've been reading all of the reviews and they are hilarious as everyone seems to use extreme sarcasm to describe how much they hate the film. All the reviews are true, the movie seems to be written by two year olds that think farts are funny. Its extra shallow, repetitive and not that funny. BUT everyone has their own taste when it comes to film and someone might be afraid to admit it if they like this film because most people do not. Personally I don't think this is the worst movie I've seen. I love watching really dumb funny films because there is nothing serious in them. No thinking, no heartfelt moments, no emotions, instead it's just an easy going film to waist time on that might make you laugh here and there, but more then anything it makes you role your eyes at the movie.

A lot of people seems to have big issues with this movie; which I can't understand. This is the best parody ever made in history. I laughed so hard in the theater. And so did all other in the audience. Sure, they have some really weird jokes... but I can't stop to love it. The reason why people hate this movie is often because they want to defend the movie "300". And I agree; 300 is a great movie. But if you can't take parodies about it, you should stay away from all parodies. This movie is worth to watch for any person who is openminded and can take harmless jokes. I love the movie. Everyone I know loves the movie. So I can't understand why people here are rating it so bad. As I said; I think they are defending the movie 300 way too much. Try to lighten up; or else you shouldn't watch the daylight.

review_title: Meet the Spartans represents everything that's wrong with our society.
Caution: Side effects may include suicide.
review_detailed_main:
From the creativity-deprived Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer (Date Movie, Epic Movie, Disaster Movie) comes yet another film in their line of disastrous spoofs. With every one of these abominations that gets released on what seems to be a yearly basis, one must wonder what aspects of these films could possibly entice producers into letting this trash appear on the big screen over and over again.

To briefly state the flimsiest of plots, we follow the Spartan King Leonidas ('we won't get sued, you say? Okay then, we'll stick with Leonidas') as he leads a group of misfit soldiers defending their homeland against the invading Persians. Obviously plagiarising the visually epic 300, this film cares less about constructing a cohesive (or even logical) plot than it does about inserting an avalanche of pop culture references into every situation possible.

Whenever the term 'gratuitous' is used to describe a film, it is usually in order to criticise the excessive action, which has inevitably let down the overall appeal of a film. In this case, the excess is in relation to the directors' efforts to take a jab at every aspect of popular culture, from Michael Bay to Britney Spears, from Ugly Betty to Shrek.

Uniquely, the poor form shown in this area does not detract from the rest of the film, solely because the references are the only point of the film. There are no progressive plot points, no efforts to invoke character development, and certainly no originality in the screenplay. The allusions are about as relevant as they are funny. In fact, they frequently flirt dangerously with the line of insulting the viewer's intelligence, regardless of how seriously you take your films.

Anybody familiar with my reviewing style will know that, while I never hesitate to throw down my opinion on any film, I ultimately leave the decision up to the reader; simply offering a guide on how to critically approach the movie in question, and always accepting of other people's opinions, even if we can't agree. This is especially the case when critiquing a comedy: the most subjective of all movie genres.

I cannot offer any of my fellow film connoisseurs that sort of leeway with Meet The Spartans. Nothing about this film came even close to forcing a mere chuckle out of me, let alone matching its advertising campaign as a light-hearted laugh riot. The best example of my rage towards this film is the running time. At just over sixty minutes long, it appears that even the writer/director combination of Friedberg and Seltzer gave up after realising they had squeezed the entire pop culture landscape dry, and decided to end the film when they couldn't think of anything screen-worthy to occupy the next half-hour.

Seriously, the outstanding benefit of the American Writer's Strike was the fact that these two did not go near a keyboard for a precious few months. Just to clarify for those of you still in two minds, I despise this film with a passion; to this day, I still consider it the single worst film in history. The only thing keeping it from scoring a big, fat, satisfying zero? The IMDb won't let me.

*There's nothing I love more than a bit of feedback, good or bad. So drop me a line on jnatsis@iprimus.com.au and let me know what you thought of my review.*

review_title: Thank heaven Will Ferrell wasn't in it because it's a really hilarious spoof!
review_detailed_main: ..This is the movie Mad Comics will have wished it made! ancient history mixed with 2007 current events and celebrity happenings. All the fallen idols are skewered from Brittney and Kevin, Nicole,Paris, Lohan. All this happening while a complete satire of the "300" is reworked.Sorbo and McQuire are excellent as is the Xerxes dude from Borat.Carman Electra has finally found a genre where her over-the-top performances and boobs work. The pop culture American Idol and Dancing with the Stars fit easily into this production. The dancing was humorous and the finale was mind boogling. One of the memorable scenes was the Persian ballet as they catapulted off the cliff. Great anxiety-elimination movie. Something for everyone, including the homophobic, ha ha.

I think most of the reviews of this film are WAY harsh. It's a farce, for chrissakes! A broad, bawdy romp that riffs on every scene in "The 300," from which it was derived. Incidentally, not to see the original "300" would make watching this film a colossal waste of your time, for this same reason. I thought the star of the film who portrayed Leonitus, Sean MaGuire, was a spot-on, dead ringer for the original, and funny as hell. One the negative side, some of the gags in this movie tended to go on a little too long to sustain the laugh, but many of the scenes in this movie I thought were hilarious, just dying to be spoofed. Again, this isn't Ben Hur, nor was it meant to be. Lighten up folks, and enjoy.

I've not been this disappointed with a movie in a long time. Sub-consciously when you go to watch this movie you expect a wyans brothers film like Scary Movie or 'Drink Juice...' but the end product just isn't funny. There was not one point where I laughed, no memorable moments and I jus kept thinking 'What a waste of time and money'. Yes, they successfully managed to cut down the plot of the 300 and mix in quickly dated references to elements of pop culture but they missed out the part where they insert jokes. PLEASE take this as a warning, I love this type of film and was buzzed about this film the most out of all the releases at the moment but this is the winters hugest disappointment.

review_title: Not as bad as Disaster Movie, but still a very,very poor film
review_detailed_main: I don't take pleasure in criticising Friedberg and Seltzer's spoof movies, but I do seriously dislike them. Not only are they not funny or irrelevant but they are a complete waste of time. Meet the Spartans is not as abysmal as Disaster Movie, which is by far and away the worst of their spoof movies and quite possibly the worst spoof movie ever. However, that is not saying much, for it is a very poor movie, junk-food cinema at its worst some people have described it. The film is very poorly made, with very slapdash camera work and fake looking sets. I personally thought some of the costumes were nice and the soundtrack was tolerable. Asides from the scenery and the in general cheap look of the film, other failures are in the jokes and in the acting. The acting to say the least was atrocious with Kevin Sorbo and Sean Maguire playing themselves and Carmen Electra simply dreadful as Queen Margo. The jokes, what happened to them? Constant homophobic jokes about men in codpieces and scatter shot send ups of contemporary pop culture, they were close to offensive rather than funny and you really do get the sense you've seen it all before. Plus the plot line was almost non-existent. Overall, I didn't hate Meet the Spartans as much as Disaster Movie(or Epic Dud...excuse me, Epic Movie for that matter) but it is for me a poor film. 2/10 Bethany Cox

review_title: This Movie Wasn't What I Was Hoping For
review_detailed_main:
I love funny movies. The Scary Movie series was really good. Epic Movie also had a high rating on my part. Tonight Me and my friends (we are 14) went to see Meet The Spartans. All I can say is, we had more fun laughing at each other than the movie. There was no story line to it at all. It was filled with advertisements from companies like Coke and Gatorade. There were a couple funny parts but not enough to keep you focused. Not enough parodies. We read tons of reviews online and all of them had low ratings but we didn't believe them. We thought they just didn't have a sense of humor. We were wrong, this movie didn't have a sense of humor. Lots of scenes in the trailer are not in the movie. When the movie started there was only about 20 other people in the theater. When the credits started at the end. At the most 10 were left.

So no, PLEASE believe me. Take this from a 14 year old guy who laughs at everything, don't waste your money on this. Go see something better like Cloverfield.

review_title: Yeah this film is really bad.
review_detailed_main:
Friedberg/Seltzer responsible for some of the biggest abominations in film history. This is no different. The jokes never once made me laugh, the characters are really annoying, the acting is garbage, and the effects suck. It is following the story of the movie "300", but it just keeps shoving pop culture references in your face the whole time. They also have a lot of gay jokes that are really unfunny, and unclever. There is also a running gag of famous celebrities' vaginas. How could that in any way be funny? (Friedberg/Seltzer film conversation) "Hey what random unfunny thing now should we insert in to mindf*ck the audience." "How about we show the audience Britny Spears' vagina censored" "Hey that is an awesome idea. Now where is my crack." It is one of the worst films I've ever seen just like every other movie these "geniuses" have made.

0 stars out of 4

review_title: How the legendary script from which came a legendary movie has begun!!
review_detailed_main:
EXT. SPARTAN'S SQUARE---DAY

JASON FRIEDBERG:Hey,Aaron,i just got an idea.

AARON SELTZER:Speak up.

JASON FRIEDBERG:It's an idea for the movie.A great movie.An epic movie.

AARON SELTZER:No.It can't be!

JASON FRIEDBERG:It can be.I just got it,remember?It's about this guy's in the ancient Sparta.They have sword's and everything.

AARON SELTZER:No.

JASON FRIEDBERG:Yeah,yeah,yeah.And big sword's.Not just regular sword's but like really,really big sword's.

AARON SELTZER:Oh boy,you just ruined your own idea.

JASON FRIEDBERG:W-what?How?

AARON SELTZER:Well,they had no big sword's in Sparta.You know?They had like,knifes.And they used them to kill someone.You know,it all happened once upon a time ago in Sparta where they used knifes to kill an enemy.They were all strong and everything.And when they were attacked by an African emperor...

JASON FRIEDBERG:Persian!(Interrupt's)

AARON SELTZER:Don't interrupt me,it's the same thing,the same continent.

JASON FRIEDBERG:OK,sorry!

AARON SELTZER:Where was i?Oh yeah.So,when they were attacked by an African emperor called Ceaser...

JASON FRIEDBERG:No,it wasn't Cesar.I think Cesar ruled in China.You know,samurai's and everything.I think Spartan's were attacked by Napoleon.

AARON SELTZER:Yeah,that's the one.I've heard of him.Yeah,that's his name.Anyway,when they were attacked by Napoleon of Africa,a strong emperor ten feet high with long yellow hair and blue eyes and big Dick that blocked the sun,253 Spartan's gathered lead by William Wallace...

JASON FRIEDBERG:No,wrong again.William Wallace wasn't a Spartan.I've heard he was Greek that fought for England against Scotish forces in World War II.

AARON SELTZER:Okay,he was a bloody Greek,so what?Then what was the name of that guy that almost defeated Napoleon?

JASON FRIEDBERG:I think it was a woman.I can't remember her name.It started with C.Something like Clementa or Cleasanta or...I don't know!

AARON SELTZER:Cleopatra!

JASON FRIEDBERG:Yeah,that's right.That's the name.Cleopatra!

AARON SELTZER:I thought she was that Queen of England or something.They even named the drink after her.Bloody something.

CUT TO:

EXT. SPARTAN'S SQUARE---MANY HOUR'S LATER

AARON SELTZER:Oh,OK!That sound's like a good idea.Sure.

JASON FRIEDBERG:My God!I have a good feeling about this one.It's going to be a masterpiece!You hear me,masterpiece!?

review_title: The Worst Attempt at Comedy I have Ever Seen
One of the greatest movies ever

review_detailed_main: This is made for laughing.. not a serious hollywood story movie.. i like this humor 😆

review_title: A few good moments, but mostly dreck.
review_detailed_main:
There are a few funny moments, but not enough to bother paying to see this film. If you didn't have to pay to see it and had access to a fast-forward button, it's fairly amusing.

Mostly it's an attempt to parody things and it's not done very well. The few laughs it does get are, well, just that. Few.

Carmen Electra needs to find a new line of work - this comes off as fairly demeaning even to her.

You sit and watch this film and wonder 'Wow, people were *paid* to make this?" I mean, there's people on Youtube with more talent, but no one's paying them. Sadly?

review_title: Not a bad spoof; barring some loose script & gross stuff
~~*Meet the Spartans Is NOT worth seeing at the cinemas!*~~
review_detailed_main: Meet the Spartans is a HUGE rip off of 300 and a stupid idiotic film! Most of the so called "Humorous scenes" were really not funny at all, the start was okay but when the movie really gets into the story you realize it was a waste of money. Some of the scenes were disturbing and made me feel sick. One scene was especially annoying was the Pit of Death, I completely over the whole Pit of Death scene, the first time someone got thrown in I thought it was sort of funny then it seemed like everyone was getting thrown in and it became very annoying. I would not recommend watching this movie at the cinemas, it is a complete waste of time and money! For those who would like to see it, maybe borrow it from Videoezy or something when it is released because it's not worth buying on DVD. In this movie there is a lot of sexual scenes, and probably wouldn't be suitable for under 13's to see this movie.

Going into Meet the Spartans, I did not fully expect a 300 spoof to last the entire length of the film. Needless to say, it did. While the film did have some laughs, I will give it that, I was a little taken aback at the overwhelming level of gay jokes, vomit/assorted spew gags, fart jokes, and gratuitous Carmen Electra body shots. Perhaps if you are in the age range 12-17 (or maybe beyond) you may find this movie funny. Personally, I found parts of this movie funny, but as a whole, I felt like I had been ripped off when I left the theater. It was short, but maybe in this case this is actually a positive thing, because after much longer, I'm not sure if I would have been able to remain in my seat.

Age: 19 Gender: male Tastes: usually will enjoy the occasional fart/sex/etc joke, but in this case, maybe this movie crossed the line a little.

In conclusion, if Epic Movie is in your top ten, you will probably love this movie.

review_title: Go see Cloverfield and don't waste your money.
review_detailed_main: All I can say about this movie is Please don't waste your money!! THe movie starts out really good but eventually it just starts dragging out its jokes until they just get lame, This movie is kind of like that person in school who tells a really good joke, but then it also has the other person who completely takes the joke and ruins it. To sum it up everything is just dragged out way too much and many of the same jokes are repeated way to often, Don't get me wrong it also contains some extremely funny spoofs, but just wait to rent it so you don't waste your money on the other 75% garbage. If you really want to enjoy yourselves just go see Cloverfield or some other comedy thats on your list and pass this one up until you can rent it for around 3$

review_title: Well, at least it's not as bad as "Disaster Movie"!
review_detailed_main:
As this film begins, you see an ancient Greek guy inspecting babies. One is a baby Shrek and the puppet looked 100% plastic and stupid--and then began spewing green slime. And so begins this pile of manure. Soon, eating canned dog food, killer penguins (which crap on the leading man), laughing at the death of Anna Nicole Smith and the like follow in this dreadful film. It's obvious that this is going to be a very, very long movie.

Like "Disaster Movie", "Superhero Movie" and 1001 other iterations, this movie was simply dreadful. While not quite as horrible as "Disaster Movie", this is like saying that Ebola isn't quite as bad as and the Pneumonic Plague--neither one is particularly nice! Why anyone would pay for such a dreadful experience is beyond me.

So why is this movie so bad? Well, it's obvious that the movie was made cheaply and the film makers didn't care if most people would never go see this film. All you needed, in their opinion, was an ample supply of stupid teenagers with money! And, apparently, there are LOTS of stupid and gullible teens out there! So, with such love expectations, why bother with decent writing or acting?! And, again because you are appealing to the lowest common denominator, why not fill it with cursing, spitting, fart and wiener jokes?! It's not like it takes a lot of talent or imagination to employ this sort of humor. Only a few times did I laugh...but this was awfully rare.

Most of the suggestions I made for "Disaster Movie" would also apply to this film and I don't want to repeat them again. Still, I'll try to recap the important points. Try to parody less films and put quality into the ones you do parody. Get writers who are not idiots or squirrels. Avoid wiener, spit or poop humor. And finally, maybe just stop making these type of films. "Airplane" and "Hot Shots" were good films as were their sequels. Otherwise, it probably would have been best to quit making goofy parody movies then instead of bleeding a totally dead franchise for yet another dreadful so-called comedy.

By the way, I just noticed that star of this film Carmen Electra and Hitler share the same birthday. Coincidence? I think not!

review_title: God Help Me, I actually laughed

review_detailed_main:
A must see of 2008 if you like comedies.I don't care what some say but this film is very creative and witty minds work.

First of all it is much more enjoyable than the far-fetched 300; characterisation, story and costumes reflect certain reality of ancient Greece which makes you laugh and laugh and laugh.I loved the fat Persian king and the masculine Spartan king; a sharp contrast between the two is definitely drawing attention to their sizes (incl their genitals), but not to their races on the contrary. :)

Although the acting is superbly carried out, I guess it wouldn't be very difficult to replace the players with those from Mykonos and Lesbos.I give them 10 out of 10.**********

I had first watched this movie before watching 300. I had still given it a 5. Today I watched it after watching 300 and I must say, their efforts deserve some appreciation. Ofcourse it's not consistently funny, but some jokes had me in stitches. I would give 7 for the attempt, maybe giving it a 6 for the lack of consistency. Dunno what all the hate is about.

review_title: Yes It's Rubbish But Is It The Worst Film You've Ever Seen ?
review_detailed_main:
This is one of these films that is considered to be one of the worst in the history of cinema . It's certainly rubbish but is it really a contender for worst film ever made ? What is suffers from is that it's a sketch show premise stretched out to feature length premise and since there's only two targets , the movie 300 and the cult of celebrity , the premise is stretched way beyond breaking point , especially since the writers and directors Friedberg and Seltzer only see 300 as a foundation to hang gay jokes upon . The Spartans were gay so we get gag after unsubtle gag involving both blatant and latent homosexuality . In fact the jokes are so inoffensive no matter how crude they are that you'd think they were written by Hilary Clinton

The other failing is that we're shown umpteen parodies of celebrities but you're totally puzzled as to who they're supposed to be . I thought one of the celebs was Chris Hansen but apparently it was a presenter from American Idol , one celebrity mentions Scientology and it was only then I realised it was meant to be Tom Cruise ( or was it John Travolta ? ) and we see " Simon Cowell " who'd have a hard time convincing Stevie Wonder it's Simon Cowell > Maybe MST would have worked better on radio than the silver screen ?

Yes MST is absolute rubbish but I hasten to add that it's maybe not the worst comedy Friedberg and Seltzer never mind the worst comedy or worst film ever made . At least the cast manage a dead pan manner throughout , though laughing and smiling isn't something you'd associate with this film be it working on it or watching . You do get the feeling that perhaps the cast deserved better

All I have to say is about 20 mins into the movie I was ready to leave. There was a lot of men on men action that was done to death. It was a snorefest. People actually walked out on the movie. For a spoof movie I was very disappointed. It is really hard to do bad on a spoof movie, but they did. Also, there was a lot of advertising, I left like I was watching t.v. at one point. I really do not understand how a movie like this made number one the 1st week, but I can tell you after the word gets out it will not last. This was a made for DVD movie and it did not belong in the theater.The only reason I gave it a 2 is because Hercules was in it and the girl that played Paula did a great job. That is it.

I rate this movie as 3 out of 10, to appeal ordinary audience. However, I have got this feeling that the writers of these series (scary movie, date movie, epic movie and meet the Spartans) are extremely successful. It's true that they have produced absolutely the most money-wasting times in cinema, however, I HAVE WATCHED THEM ALL! yes, they are cheap laughs. but if they make another similar film in the future, i can tell that deep in your mind you will have a slice of curiosity (with extra bit of push)that might get you to sit in front of the screen again.

most directors aim to make films like godfather or shaw-shank or matrix. they are artistic in that way. however, cheap laughs are also a form of behaviour art.

review_title: Simply the worst movie I have EVER seen
review_detailed_main:
Like my summary says, its the worst movie I have ever seen. And I'm not saying that in the impulsive kinda way. I'm saying it in the: "I thought it over and I cant think of a worse movie than this" kinda way. The jokes are terrible and since its a non-stop stream of jokes there's really no part of the movie which isn't terrible.

I suppose I should give some credit to the film makers that the props used in the film are pretty decent. But then again, if everything looked as if it were made out of cardboard I at least would have had something to laugh about.

Avoid this at all cost. If I had the choice of paying 10 to watch this movie or paying 10 to spend the duration of the entire movie (Which thankfully isn't that long) playing with two paperclips I'd go for the paperclips, all the way.

This is without doubt the worst and gayest movie ever made!!! I give it a star but only because IMDb won't let me rate it less than one star. 0(zero) might be too much for this movie also. Acting awful. Plot line awful. Humor nonexistent (which is rather odd for a parody). I am glad I didn't pay money to see the movie though. That would have been a big mistake. This movie truly sucks. I mean I saw bad movies before, but god damn, this is incredible. A few weeks ago I was searching IMDb trying to find the worst movie ever produced so I could see it out of curiosity. Afterwards I tried finding it on the internet (p2p stuff) and tried downloading but without success. I was just curios to see how bad a movie can suck. Hopefully now I have to look no further, fore I found Meet the Spartans. And this truly is the worst movie ever made!

This is the first time I've ever felt the need to write a review about a movie, the only reason i bothered is if i can deter one person from seeing this then I've saved someone the torment of sitting through the worst movie I've ever seen. To start the jokes aren't funny the and the acting (if you can call it that) is of a schoolboy standard and the directing as well as the writing is thoughtless. review_title: Could Be the Greatest Movie Since Scary Movie 4
review_detailed_main: If you've seen Scary Movie 4, Let Me Admit that this is possibly the greatest movie ever made. to others it may not be worth it watching it although if you watch it a little more you get used to it, the cameos of Famous People are memorable and the advertising campaigns sure show a lot of information for todays products. overall id give it and also my review two thumbs up for effort. in my less then positve terms some scenes may contain errors and the death pit thing is cool but it can get a little overused. if you are a Aaron and Jason fanatic then you'll probably be comfortable watching this movie on my perspective! overall id say still that this is the most hilarious movie!

review_title: To the haters....... Chill!!!!!!! It's obvious comedy
review_detailed_main:
Is an unapologetically over-the-top parody that doesn't shy away from its mission: to make you laugh by any means necessary. Yes, it's a blatant rip-off of "300"-and it proudly owns that fact, turning the epic drama into a playground of absurd comedy. The directors went out of their way to deliver humor that's outrageous, self-aware, and intentionally ridiculous.

This isn't a movie for serious critique; it's one to sit back, relax, and enjoy. It's not trying to be groundbreaking-it's trying to be fun, and it succeeds. If you love slapstick humor, pop culture references, and some good old-fashioned silliness, "Meet the Spartans" is definitely worth the watch. Just remember, it's comedy-not history!

review_title: Some funny parts, but no heart
review_detailed_main:
This is probably the nicest review for this movie ever. Kinda sad.

I love parody movies. I will admit, I am of the very very very few that liked Epic Movie. And even when people were saying how terrible Meet The Spartans looked I still wanted to see it. Well, just kinda disappointed in what I saw.

First off, the running time. An hour? And that is not counting the "deleted" scenes in the ending credits! They allowed an hour long movie? The running time not only makes you feel cheated, but it also shows at one point, the writers and directors said "Oh crap. We've run out of movies to spoof and celebrities to make fun of. Better call it a movie."

And what is with the recent trend of these parody movies? C'mon, we had enough jokes about Paris, Britney and American Idol in Date Movie and Epic Movie! Look for some new material! Sadly, this should have been called "Pop Culture Movie." And it will be forgotten in 10 years while the things they make fun of fade away. That's why true spoof movies spoof timeless classics (Spaceballs, for the win).

And we are aware of what movies you are spoofing too. What the heck? "...just like Tobey Maguire did in Spiderman 3." Who's narrating this film? John Madden?

Still I gotta admit, some scenes did get a laugh from me. But unfortunately most of those were shown in the commercials/previews, such as the Rambo scene (which was shown at the end of the movie, just slapped in there randomly). And of course, Carmen Electra is always easy on the eyes for sure. One scene with her made me hungry for pizza (those who've seen this will know what I mean). Oh and the actress who plays both Britney and Paris? Way hotter than the both of them will ever be!

So overall I cannot declare this a spoof movie, rather a quickly rushed mix of 300 and everything that is big in pop culture. Want a better one? The Scary Movies are pretty good, and the recently released Superhero Movie knows what to do. Or if you want classic spoofs, rent Spaceballs and the Naked Gun movies.

review_title: One of the worst films I ever saw
review_detailed_main: Please, 'PLEASE' refrain from seeing this movie. It will be an utter waste of time. Surprising what load of wanton, brazen, offensive comedies come out of Hollywood! not even 5 minutes in the movie, it became so boring and the comic lines and reliefs were abysmal. It was my biggest mistake in spending money for buying the DVD. But now I know. Additionally, I think its not worth the effort trying to make parodies out of movies which themselves do not come up to the standards of making any considerable mark in the annals of movie history and fame. Saying any more about the movie would be spilling the beans, and I would not like to do so. My advise to anybody who is forced to watch this is to avoid under all circumstances and rather watch a dubbed Chinese movie or any other language film with subtitles. The pain would certainly be less.

review_title: I'm feeling generous so it gets a 2/10.
review_detailed_main:
The first thing I have to say about this film is that it is easily one of the most appalling films I have ever watched. It frankly disgusts me that these people were given millions of dollars to produce such utter shite. I laughed once throughout the entire film at a line delivered in approximately the first 2 minutes, the rest was embarrassing and insulting to watch. I can justify watching an awful film if I can laugh at it, such as 'House of the Dead', which despite being a train wreck of a film was actually unintentionally quite funny. However, Meet the Spartans despite aiming to be funny was frankly excruciating to watch. All I could think of throughout was that I was slowly losing an hour of my life and £5.50 that I would never see again.

The jokes are immature and at times homophobic. The humour is basically trash that I'm almost certain could and would have only appealed to a group of 15 year old boys. Upon leaving the cinema I have never seen such a depressed group of people. The movie is from the same writers as 'Date Movie', 'Epic Movie' and the Scary Movie films. I personally am quite a fan of the Scary Movie films and thought I would give this the benefit of the doubt despite being very disappointed with 'Date Movie'. I have however learnt my lesson now and shall be investing no more money into watching any of Jason Friedberg or Aaron Seltzers films.

The cast is not particularly promising but neither did I expect it to be a death sentence. Sean Maguire and Carmen Electra both star in the main roles, but I personally don't think the casting had anything to do with the fall down of this film, nothing could have saved this. The script is frankly appalling, the story is messy and the humour is just offensive; sadly not in a tongue in cheek way. I think that Mr. Friedberg and Mr. Seltzer need to learn the use of subtly. Sometimes less really is more. It seemed with this film everything including the jokes had to be taken to the extreme. Their exhausting efforts to be funny are actually the only funny thing about this film.

review_title: By no means a GOOD movie, but not AS bad as I though it would be.
Even worse than it's rumored to be
review_detailed_main:
This hideous excuse for a movie doesn't even deserve a score of 1 out of 300, let alone 1 out of 10. However, sadly, there is no way for me to hand out a score lower than that.

After sitting through almost one and a half hour of this worthless garbage, I hand out the first 1 I've ever given a movie in my entire life, and I still feel like I'm being too generous.

Every scene of 'Meet the Spartans' is extremely predictable to most human beings capable of extending their mental abilities beyond that of a seagull, since they all involve some kind of punchline thrown in at the exact moment where you would expect it. Even if you're into the kind of sad humor this movie features, 'Meet the Spartans' will fail to surprise you a single time, and thus, fall flat.

A major ingredient of 'Meet the Spartan'-humor is the idea that anything can be funny if you add a famous name, however, just trying to be funny by randomly insulting celebrities is a very cheap way to produce laughter. People will laugh when they recognize the celebrity-look-alike on screen without thinking.

I'm not trying to insult the people who made 'Meet the Spartans'. It is my belief that they just didn't care about quality when they made this movie.

As a side note, after seeing 'Meet the Spartans', a friend of mine just raised the score of every Uwe Boll move he's ever seen.

review_title: The invading force includes the likes of a mutant Paris Hilton, the Transformers, the Ghost Rider, and Rocky Balboa.

review_detailed_main:
If you haven't figured it out yet, this movie sucks! A friend brought over a copy last night and after watching what felt like the longest 40 minutes my life, I couldn't take it anymore and had to turn it off. I usually make fun of bad movies, but this was so bad that I am actually angry and insulted that it was ever made.

There is not one redeeming quality about this entire movie. They drag every joke premise out for about 10 minutes. It was torturous to watch!!! I implore everyone who reads this to return your DVD to the store and demand your money back!!! Why should you be doped into paying for what amount to a $19.00 drink coaster.

My sister purchased a copy of Date Movie from a bargain-bin at Block Buster. It was so bad, she went back to the store the next day and INSISTTED on a refund. They gave her a hard time, but finally agreed to a store credit. If we all take her lead and insist that the store manager refund out money, then maybe, just maybe Hollywood will take notice and start requiring some standard from their film makers.

And don't be afraid or intimidated, we pay a lot of money to be entertained, what right do they have to keep our money if they can't deliver on the goods! Sometime it's not that hard to get your money back. I walked out of Mary Rielly in 1996 and asked to see the theater manager, before I could finish explaining why i was walking out, he just offered up two theater vouchers for another movie.

Stick to your guns and DEMAND your refund!!!

Poor reviews are only from people who don't like spoofs. Common sense; don't watch spoof movies if you don't like them? Have a seat and relax for a good laugh. Not every movie has to be taken seriously. It's stupid because it's supposed to be.

review_title: An okay parody, i cant see why this movie is hated by so many
review_detailed_main: I wasn't expecting a lot from this movie because of all the bad reviews, but my sister liked so I watched it hoping to get few laughs. That's exactly what I got, couple of good laughs and some fun while watching this. The acting, writing and directing is pretty much what I expect from this kind of parody, not great, but does the job. The jokes were easy to spot, so you probably wont miss a thing even if you take a bathroom break and leave the movie running. A lot of the jokes were on the media, commercials and off-course modern movies, mainly 300. In the end, this is an okay movie, and if you liked epic movie and scary movies you will find this worth watching. If you don't like that kind of movies, do not watch this.

review_title: I forgot how terrible this movie was...
review_detailed_main:
When this movie first came out in theaters, I went to go see it with a friend of mine, who was terminally ill. He wanted to go see it on a day that he was feeling well enough to go out, as he was a huge fan of the parody genre. At the end of the mercifully just-over-an-hour film, he turned to me and apologized for making me sit through that with him, then told me that the movie must have shortened the time he had left.

In the next two years that followed, I had pretty much forgotten all about Meet the Spartans and its litany of terrible jokes and stupid sight gags. My friend passed away. I started to go to university. I got a job. And many, many better movies came out. Then, two weeks ago, the unthinkable happened. This abomination of a motion picture was unceremoniously tossed back into my life in the form of a DVD. My roommate had found it in the bargain bin at Wal-Mart and wished to watch it. I hesitantly agreed, hoping that maybe on the second viewing it would be better. Unsurprisingly, it wasn't. The jokes were still unfunny, gross-out humor that would only amuse middle school boys was still abundant, and the theme of "hurr durr, look at the ghey guyz" was still the main takeaway from this film.

I had the misfortune of sitting through this atrocity twice. Save yourself the pain and misery and don't even see it once.

I'm not going to say much about this movie. It just blew. I liked the Scary Movies, that's just my taste in comedies. But the latest movies in this genre just have the lowest level of humor. This whole dancing thing and the gay thing were just so cheesy and annoying that I almost couldn't sit trough the whole movie. But I did, and I still reject the day that I did that... I also hated that they did BAD impressions of the famous people of America, favorite games, TV shows that are watched by a lot of people and other movies or characters of that movie. And then the thing with the pit of death! I guess they thought their movie was too short so they stretched out a joke so far that it is not funny anymore. And the sexuality of Carmen Electra was way over the top. I gave it a 2, not a 1, because I thought there are movies worse then this one. I haven't found them yet, but I know that they're out there. Don't get me wrong and I said it before: I like parodies and I like the kind of humor Leslie Nielsen, kind of, introduced. But this was nothing like it. They tried, but didn't succeed. If your curious about this movie, watch it. But if you're not, don't do this to yourself. It's just not worth it. Life's too short.

One word to describe this film is garbage, another one is awful, then there's terrible and so on and so on.

The film is just one very bad attempt at comedy after another and then again and again and so to the very bitter end. That seems to be the full content of the movie just poor jokes all the way through. The first Scary Movie film was actually quite good but they have went downhill dramatically since and this is just the worst of them all.

A question that needs asking is why does everything have to be so funny, why not have some more actual film content - I mean I don't mind spoof movies, 'Just Another Teen Movie' was great, Scary Movie 1 was good but this is genuinely garbage. One good thing is Carmen Electra - she does add a little glamour to the movie, but it's just so full of very very poor 'funny bits' that it's just not funny.

I KNEW going in, that the "creative" minds behind this movie were the same team that gave us EPIC MOVIE - a comedy so bad that I wanted to bribe the theater manager to take the prints out in back, pour gasoline over them and incinerate them, to spare other poor souls having to go through the torture. Having seen 300, I was pretty sure that it would help me understand the pop culture references and appreciate the "wacky" humor more.

And it certainly would. If I were, say, somewhere between 9 and 15 years old.

Granted, there is a mild guffaw here and there, but VERY mild. Vomit jokes, boob jokes, gay jokes, poop jokes (and PENGUIN poop, no less), "STOMP THE YARD" and dance-off jokes; they've all been done before and done BETTER. These guys don't seem to know when something works and when a joke goes on waaay too long, (the dance-off and Oracle temple scenes could've been about thirty seconds long, and they STILL wouldn't be funny.)

It's too bad the cast was so willing to dive in and do anything and everything that was asked of them, because the script and the writers let them down big time.

Where the hell is Team ZAZ (Zucker/Abrams/Zucker) when you need them? They literally refined and RE-DEFINED this genre of comedy, and they need to school these guys on how its done.

And look - how can moviegoers complain about true hacks like Uwe Boll, when THESE guys keep getting money to make clunkers like this, too???

review_title: An unmitigated disaster on every level imaginable
review_detailed_main:
I don't know what I was thinking, I really don't. I should have known that spending an evening watching Meet The Spartans would have been a waste of time and I can only put the decision to do so down to some inherent sadomasochism and a Freudian desire to bring myself pain, but good lord Meet the Spartans is terrible. In fact it's more than terrible. This movie is so unquestionably bad that it's staggering, it must take an unprecedented lack of talent to produce something so bad. So without further ado people I have to beg you, in the wake of this latest fiasco, PLEASE stop going to see movies by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer. You know the sort - Scary Movie, Epic Movie, Date Movie yadda yadda yadda, each one of them a tedious marathon of pop-culture jokes blessed with the ability to miss anything that even resembles a funny joke yet still have idiots flocking to see them as they roll off the assembly line. This plea might seem hypocritical given that I've seen it, but hey, I played with the pirates and downloaded it for free. Get out of that one fatty.

And if the abominable back-catalogue that these people have smeared across the face of the world isn't enough to convince you that this movie is painful to watch, let me put it this way: You remember all the classic spoof movies? Airplane, Hot Shots, Spaceballs, Top Secret and the immortal Naked Gun series? What made those movies hilarious examples of just how funny spoof films could be was down to two things; they told their own stories and took themselves seriously. No matter how recycled their plots might have been they were still fresh spins on the material and no matter how ludicrous the jokes got the actors still treated it with a deadpan sensibility.

Meet the Spartans on the other hand doesn't do either of these things. It's just 300 with loads of gay jokes thrown in and actors who pull ludicrous faces throughout, each one of them missing the obvious point that for things to be funny, they shouldn't be behaving as if they are. Admittedly, the bit involving Leonidas beating the living daylights out of his son raises a chuckle but everything else falls dismally flat. In fact, it's hard to consider them to be jokes at all - most of the so called comic set pieces simply involve the Spartans doing something that the writers have seen on TV. They dance like the street gangs in Stomp The Yard, discuss terms with Xerxes by appearing on Deal Or No Deal and Rocky Balboa turns up as a member of the Persian army, all while tumbleweeds spin past at an alarming rate, the writers seemingly expecting their audience to laugh out of simple familiarity.

So there we have it. I did not think I would ever see the day where I'd see a spoof movie so dismally free of comedy that not even watching it drunk off my face with six of my mates could make me laugh but it has happened. Hands down one of the worst films of the year thus far and likely to appeal only to two groups of people: morons and the rich, white-bred thirty year olds that made it. When there are funnier 300 parodies to be found on youtube that last mere minutes, you have to wonder why they bother.

review_title: Ugliest movie i have ever seen!
review_detailed_main: Ugliest movie i have ever seen. Waste of time,if i was a producer of 300,i would open a case about this garbage movie.59 minutes...is there a movie with 59 minutes...Ohh my god,the money you spent for this awful money,you should spend that for poor people...Please don't watch this movie...You will hate movies after that garbage! And Carmen Electra,the most desirable woman on earth.Why you played in this movie?Why? You can lost a lot of fans after that. İ really cant imagine,which brain can make this kind of movie. Hollywood,in my opinion,lost a lot of blood after making this kind of movies:Disaster movie(Really a disaster),Meet the spartans,Superhero movie...why you make this kind of movies,you cant see the truth,we hate that!

I like a good comedy as much as anyone. Heck, I like an average comedy better than most. I could not take more than a few minutes of this loser. I had turned to it on Cinemax because I saw it had Keven Sorbo in it. I like Sorbo, but he couldn't save this.

It is essentially the very same attempted joke (I say attempted because something has to actually amuse to be identified as a joke) over and over again for the entire course of the movie. The few jokes that are actually attempted in dialog are all very old lines stolen from childish jokes you've heard many times for many years. They are pathetic.

These 'filmmakers' (and I'd rather call them phlegmmakers ... this parenthetic joke is better than anything in the movie, btw) have nothing but contempt for movie goers, and are quite content to take your money and offer nothing in return.

I thought at times the movie was funny and the actors matched their characters well but felt as though it copied (a bit too much) other movies such as Monty Python, Men in Tights and scary movie, for example. Sometimes this humor gets a little old in other movies. I also thought that the movie was too short. There were 20 minutes of previews and roughly an hour of actual movie. It should have been longer and more creative. I had such high expectations from the previews but after about half way through the movie, it was difficult to give praise to the attempted humor.

It wasn't worth paying $7!! I was disappointed! I gave the movie a 3 because I laughed at times.

This is arguably one of the most well executed films out there. The timing of the comical aspects matched superbly with the delicately placed visual-audio effects. The cinematic atmosphere provided an elegant, yet intentionally brusque plot that frankly served as a nice complement to the pop culture genre. The inner child that is inherent within all Spartans was a clear example of this, not to mention the lovable Father-Son relationship as exemplified at the beginning of the sequence.

I would highly recommend seeing this movie as soon as possible. You don't want to miss out.

Let's go back to the facts. the movie had lots of comedy attempts. Then there's the references.

There were a lot of spoofs of movie scenes

They made fun of Britney

They also made fun of many people

Let's see, there was also lots of false references of many things, such as sexual content.

Oh, and also, should we not forget the very sexual themes. They purposely cover the women's privates, which is disgusting.

If that's not enough, I guess "Leave Britney Alone" says the rest.

review_title: I haven't even put a rating to this...that's how bad it is.
review_detailed_main:
I am proud to admit I have a soft spot for the guilty pleasures named Scary Movie 1, 2, 3, 4, Date Movie and Epic Movie, but these are all very silly, especially the last two. And most of them, save for Scary Movie, are filled with pointless slapstick/dick/fart jokes save for a few actually funny, clever jokes few and far between, but this is ridiculous. It's the same old slapstick and body excrement jokes that get old faster than a speeding bullet. I saw absolutely no point to this whatsoever, and I was only interested in seeing it because of the Britney jokes they showed on the ads, and I will say I used to be a Britney fan and love making fun of her. Shame I forgot Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg's idea of "parody" is redoing a scene from a movie verbatim with actors who look like the actors in the film they are parodying and putting WAY BELOW sub-par dick/fart/crap/boob/sex jokes in and they call it a parody. A parody is something that makes fun of something for a REASON and with A POINT. The Scary Movie movie sorta had this, saying how silly scary movies were, but the sequels, though guilty pleasures of mine, are pointless, though less pointless, than this. And Date Movie and Epic Movie (I preferred the latter over the former) are dick and fart joke movies but I enjoyed them and they are very silly and stupid, but now that I've sorta really grasped what makes a quality movie...I'm saying that this is the most POINTLESS waste of celluloid ever, and I'm really lenient when it comes to films.

But this is just stupid beyond belief. What's the next one? "We're Gonna Make Another Movie" and "parody" everything in the last year? Date Movie is about two years old and most of the pop culture jokes no one would get now because those events are behind us, the same going for Epic Movie, but to a grander scale - only a year old, but the pop culture jokes have completely died.

On the DVD commentary for Date Movie it seemed the writers understood that these movies are pointless...well...STOP MAKING THEM THEN!!!

Make a good, ORIGINAL movie for a change.

Is that too much to ask?

Wait - it probably is.

This movie was just like any other spoof. The humor presented here is very similar, if not the same as the Scary Movies, Epic Movie, Date Movie, etc.

There were one or two parts that were extremely funny, while the rest of the movie was just either a combination of overkilled jokes, or childish humor.

I went into this movie not expecting much, and came out of it not having gained much. It is a great time killer, but do not expect anything spectacular. The previews, I thought, were so much funnier than the movie itself, which is understandable because after all, it's very difficult to have a movie that generates laughter every second.

Bottomline, if you are looking for good quality humor go watch Juno, Knocked Up, or Superbad. This movie will get you a few laughs, if that.

Normally I would start off by listing the virtues of the film, following by the so so's then the bad. This movie is one of the few exceptions for there is nothing good about it except that it does eventually end.

Lemme just say, you may catch yourself chuckling here or there. Nothing thats gonna make you remember it longer than 4 seconds but there are a few, funny moments. Very few. To add tot he so so, Kevin Sorbo, an actor I actually enjoyed during the Hercules / Andromeda years, but seems lately he has become a low budget film actor. The worst part is hes probably the closest to a high roller actor on this flick, and the whole time seems like he really doesn't want to be there really never fulling the role quite as much as his partner 'Leonidas' (Sean Mauguire)who really does seem to fulfill his part, despite how horribly written it was. But all is shadowed by the Carmen ELectra, who seems to be fastly becoming the queen of spoof. Nopt much really can ever be said but she does however play a part in 1 of the worst SPOOF RIPOFFs in HISTORY. (THe scene copy'ing the "locked" Chastity belt, which was LONG TIME AGO depicted in a MUCH funnier spoof Robin Hood Men in tights....SHAME ON YOU Meet the Spartans).

Okay in ending, the movie can be easily summed up as the biggest, longest, weakest, barely funny gay joke you have ever heard. EVERY SCENE depicts in some form or another, and often distasteful gay related joke. I also must add the whole pit of death scene is early funny but horribly ruined in the same fashion a comedian gets a small laugh fromt he audience and over runs with a skit. (I DId however like seeing Britney Spears go for a dive).

SO, basically, wait till public television has it on some, spoof marathon which they do OFTEN enough to see this one within the next year....you'll be glad you waited on that penny saved.

review_title: What did you expect? Heck, it ain't all bad. - 4 of 10
review_detailed_main:
I did not begin this film with any high hopes. This is how this type of film should be approached. Cheap humor and gross jokes abound. This is how these films do it and to expect any complex humor is selling the genre short. Yes, there are much better films in the genre, but come on people, you cannot knock it for trying. It does connect on a few jokes and I found it mildly amusing for the the first half, I then started to get a little bored with it and I wandered a little. It's a good thing that it is so short. In fact, it may be too long at 84 minutes!

No, it is not Airplane or Naked Gun, but it works a little and you cannot judge these films too seriously. Don't go out of your way, but if it's on, you're likely to get a coupla yucks out of it. I consider a 5 a "take it or leave it film", so it just misses that mark. In it's genre, it is a 4 of 10.

review_title: I have not seen this movie.
review_detailed_main:
If you look through my reviews, you'll notice that I've reviewed three Scary Movies, along with Epic Movie (with which this movie deservedly shares a spot on the IMDb Bottom 100) not long ago, and in most of them I berate myself for being stupid enough to waste my time watching them. This is the first time I've ever written a review of a movie I haven't seen, and I do it only because I've thrown away so many hours watching the ridiculous tripe that these idiots continue to defecate into theaters.

In this case, thankfully, the trailer alone was enough to show me that it was going to be more of the idiotic, nonsensical garbage we have come to expect from Friedberg and Seltzer. I'm willing to bet that their parents tell people that they haven't heard from their kids in years and don't know what they are up to because they don't know how to get a hold of them. Aren't they making those movies, though? No, no, no, no, no, that's not my son. Definitely not. My son is, ah, anyone else.
