Have you seen those yellow warning signs that say "Caution: This is Sparta"? THAT is funny. You don't even have to watch it to know that this movie is not. There are a lot of times when you can ignore the nay-sayers and watch a badly reviewed movie anyway and make up your own mind. This is not one of those times.

No stars.

when i watched that film which i believe was made by a child's imagination i was filled with anticipation, but as the movie slowly progressed i became embarrassed to be in the movie. As a fan of the makers of these films i thought i was in for a treat. but i was wrong i had to endure 2 hours of sheer desperate script, i was so bored i thought it could not get even worse. but it did! especially when they included parts like a robot with a video of a lad shouting. " leave Britney alone". what the hell was that all about, it was not even in the slightest bit funny or necessary. to give the movie compliments i thought the producers put in tremendous efforts and irony into the film. it did sound interesting at first and most of the scenes which were funny were released in the trailers.

in the film they have copied films like 300, and famous people which are often minipulated for a little mistake like Britney spears. but they did over anticipate how good the movie was, looking at it from their point of view i can understand how difficult it must be to mock these films. but to end this aggressive review on a sad note: the best part of that film was leaving the cinema

Every year a film comes out that parodies some of the bigger hits of the years before. This time 300 got mangled and mangled badly. Parodies work when they fire off a good number of sequences that trigger laughter, but quite sadly this one fails at that. There are some bits in it that are quite good, but bits on their own are not enough.

For me the best parts of the film were in the after-credits. There was some things in there that could have fitted into the rest of the film but got placed there instead and they did well. I love films that make fun of violence, even when it's used against children. It's bad humor, but that is what it is. Humour. Nothing I'd ever approve of in real life, but on the screen it's something else.

Anyway, this one is not worth remember, not worth the tape it is filmed on and I hope the next parody tries some harder and does not take a lot of US only references because it just doesn't work.

4 out of 10 legendary Kings queen-ed.

review_title: More like Meet the no talents
Twisted humor will crack you up
review_detailed_main: This movie made me laugh so hard I had to stand up, I do not understand how this movie could get such a low rating, I guess we are just very few people on this site that share this sense of humor. You would, like the other movies produced by the same people, need to have seen the movies they are making fun with, in order to find this movie even more funny. This movie is like one big laugh, you can barely catch your breath before the next thing crack you up, you would have to be extremely dull if you do not find this movie the slightest big funny. This twisted form of humor is just so great, and the way things happen in the movie is truly epic, you constantly get surprised of the makers ways of introducing stuff, you just sit back laugh and wonder how the hell did they come up with stuff like that. If you are sort of a movie geek, and have good humor, this is one of the funniest movies you can watch these days.

review_title: Better than In the Name of the King
review_detailed_main:
Not the best or funniest movie ever, but still made me laugh a few times. And it was definitely better than the steaming pile of cat barf that is In the Name of the King.

Which happens to be directed by a steaming pile of cat barf. With a dirty diaper in flames on top of it.

The Paris Hilton bits were a bit stupid, but the Leonidas character was just hilarious. The scenes with his son made me laugh the most. The whole Rocky thing was pretty lame, also.

All in all, it's not the worst movie ever, but could have been done a bit better.

review_title: Thats it, all those previews were just a waste
In summary: Any reason to watch this show at all?
review_detailed_main:
I know from the trailer that this was meant to be a spoof of the 300 movie, but i think even spoof movies can be done with more taste. What was shown in this movie from start to the end were scene-by-scene rip-off jokes that either come off as a great laugh or just plain tasteless for the viewers.

For most part, i think there wasn't much to laugh at.

To me, the experience was an agony but i do know of people who laughed their brain off; i felt bad that the spoof was so poorly pieced together, guess the people who wrote and directed it never took a close look at other spoof movies (e.g. Spaceballs, Scary Movie 1 & 2) before doing this one ... this would have been one of the all time great spoof movies, i think the casting was the only good thing about this movie, everyone could act their respective roles really well, but for a spoof to be good, even a spoof-plot has to be properly written and directed ... which you would not find in this movie, sadly.

An utter waste of money indeed ...

Best way to know how bad it is, is simply drag someone who enjoyed 300 to see this, and record their opinion down on tape!

review_title: A few good gags. . but not quite enough

review_detailed_main:
Christ almighty. Meet the Spartans lowers the bar. Below anything we've seen before, below Epic Movie, below Date Movie, below Scary Movie 4. Unfunny, childish, crude CRAP! All the jokes, are the kind of things you giggle at when your 12...

There's no redeeming factor for this film. Every spoof, every joke is not funny.

Please people, save your money, time, life. DON'T GO TO SEE THIS!! There is no force on heaven, hell or earth that could make me watch MTS again. I would rather watch White Chicks on a continuous loop with my eyes held open by tweezers for a week than watch the trailer ever again.

As i just began to believe cinema was getting back on tracks with NCFOM and TWBB, they release the worst film of the last 20years perhaps always...

I can't believe this is top of the charts and Cloverfield, a film that has brought something new and refreshing to an overcrowded genre is mulling around the 6's or 7's.

DO NOT WATCH MEET THE SPARTANS, go see Juno, anything instead!!

review_title: well if it ain't for Carmen

review_detailed_main: Good day to all, this here is the first comment I am ever writing on IMDb. Hopefully this isn't all that bad of a review. Well, I went to a local theater one Saturday morning to watch "Meet the Spartans". Frankly I should have jumped off the top row of seats and ended up in hospital, than watch this filth. This movie is absolutely terrible, I mean it is just another parody movie, again. HOW MANY PARODIES CAN THERE BE? I mean something called "Disaster Movie" is coming out soon, and oh dear, I can tell its going to be a stinker. But "Meet The Spartans" has terrible jokes, terrible acting, and terrible use of editing and shots and stuff, in other words its like, oh you over there! Go stand there and say some stuff that doesn't make sense! Man its bad. 300 was a good movie, but when its parodied in a way like this, it gives 300 a bad name to have this hybrid parody film on its shoulders. And well thats it, I guess... just don't go see this, after all this movie, isn't Sparta.

review_title: I don't understand why they keep on making movies like this.
review_detailed_main: Some of the popular parodies like Scary movie and its sequels did well. But after that only worse and not even funny parodies came out. Date movie, Epic movie... They keep getting worse. There are so many scenes that I didn't even find funny. At all! They just repeat all the spoofs other parodies make and it just became copying off each other. The plot is completely uninteresting and I forced myself to watch the whole movie because I was about to quit after the first 20 minutes but I just wanted to see how it turned out. Also, I don't understand why actors even accept the role for this movie. This is way out of their league. And as already said, this was a complete waste of my time.

review_title: worth seeing on a cheap night or rent it
review_detailed_main:
I thought is was really funny.

It is 99% gay jokes.

I guess it could be considered offensive by too serious people.

I recommend it.

If you expect a lot from this film, you'll be disappointed.

If you have seen 300, this is worth seeing.

It is worth seeing on a cheap night or renting it.

Don't expect much.

There is nothing requiring a big screen.

I went to a cheaper matinée, I'm glad I didn't pay full price for it.

A lot didn't make sense but so long as you laugh with comedies thats the thing story lines don't matter (esspeicially for parody's)as long as you laugh a lot its good. i though Leonidas was SO funny the way he deliver some of the lines was great. LOL Paris Hilton "I'm a Hilton I don't bow, but I do bend over." Nobody i know hated it. my brother LOVED it says it was the funniest film he's ever seen. its not the funniest film i've seen but it is good i would have given it 7 or 8 but everyone said give it ten so i did. its funnier than scary movie. critical just because the characters are all over the place just as long as its funny, jeez lighten up.

check out Meet the Spartans. When I watched 300 it bothered me because it took itself so seriously and it didn't have much of a story. This doesn't have much of a story either and yes it is a rip off of 300 but it is aware that it is stupid and it is a fun diversion. I'm sure if I was a fan of 300 I would think this movie sucked but since it isn't the case, I have to say I enjoyed the movie with all its stupid humor, advertising within the film, and all the pop culture references. This movie will definitely be very dated later on but for right now its funny. However if you haven't seen 300 and don't watch much TV its really not going to be much fun at all. Most of the humor assumes that you have seen these popular shows like American Idol, Deal or No Deal, & etc. My friend hadn't seen 300 so they didn't appreciate much of the humor. Make sure you at least see 300 first and if you didn't like it you may enjoy this.

review_title: If you've seen Epic/Date Movie, you've seen this...
review_detailed_main:
I can't imagine any person in the world watching this thing more than once. You will literally chuckle one time. Aaron and Jason will continue to make these films in the hopes that people will see them and unfortunately for the intelligent people ... these movies still make enough money for them to be continuously made over and over.

95% of this film is based on 300 spoof. So basically you are watching approximately 300 gay jokes crammed into 60 minutes. The other five minutes is a joke aimed at pop culture reference to an issue earlier in the year (ie. Lindsay Lohan's rehab), product placement, a joke aimed at Carmen Electra or an out-of-place parody for another film.

The majority of the jokes are dragged on for far too long. For instance the Stomp The Yard parody lasts upward 3 minutes. This is the point where people start to think of hitting the close button on Windows Media Player. It's not even a Stomp The Yard parody since after its over the leading man says "You got served", which is of course the title for the movie You Got Served.

Take a bunch of nobody actors, add in Carmen Electra, product placement, add in stupid gay jokes, terrible visual and special effects, and then have Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer write the screenplay...you end up with a movie like Date Movie, Epic Movie and this. This movie gives Farce Of the Penguins a run for its money. Hell even the "dreaded" Blair Witch Project is not as bad as this.

If you guys want to keep your sense of humor and some brain cells, on top of your money...avoid this film at all costs.

review_title: if this movie was any good it wouldn't have a 2.5 out of 10, and thats from over 13000 people
Funny movie that needs a little bit more...

review_detailed_main: If there's anything that Date Movie and Epic Movie taught us, it's that spoof movies that are slapped together with low production values aren't exactly going to yield a positive response from viewers. It seems that after Scary Movie 4, people really don't want to see another dumb spoof comedy from anyone associated with those movies. Well, for those that were utterly disgusted by Date Movie and Epic Movie, there's nothing in Meet the Spartans that's going to make you feel any different. This movie has all the lousy production, cheap acting and stupid spoofs that you could possibly come up with for any movie or TV show released last year. So if you want to see a movie that'll poke some sort of fun at recently released movies, TV shows and famous celebrities, regardless of how embarrassing it is, then this movie might be worth a shot. As for me, I thought Date Movie and Epic movie honestly weren't that horrible. Yeah, they were about as dumb as someone with an IQ of negative 1000, but I still thought the retarded comedy had its moments, which is why I'd at least give those movies some points. And Meet the Spartans is no different; it gets points for stupid moments that made me laugh but loses points for its sheer stupidity. You're best waiting for this one to come out on DVD and renting it; I don't see this movie lasting much more than maybe a month in theaters.

review_title: Friedberg and Seltzer just don't get it.
review_detailed_main:
I admit that they've had a few chuckles, but this movie was not worth going to the cinema and watching. End of story. Scary Movie was hilarious but I don't think Scary Movie 5 will be good. They've made too many of these movies. And several more are scheduled.

Scary Movie 5

Date Movie 2 (or so I've heard)

And I'm not sure but I've also heard that Friedberg and Seltzer are working on a remake called Queen Kong for 2010.

They seriously need to stop. I don't even know why they keep going. None of the movies they make have any real humor.

This film was awful.

There were 1 or maybe 2 funny bits and thats when they weren't spoofing stuff.

Now i am not a huge fan of 300.

don't start hating me.

I can appreciate how well done it was but just wasn't entirely my type.

Kevin Sorbo and Sean Maguire are good actors who deserve better.

i hope Friedberg and Seltzer realise how much they suck and do something good and original.

i heard they have written a biopic about Liberace.

the 2 out of 10 is just me being generous.

i had the displeasure of seeing it twice because my friend wanted to see it and he regretted it after. If it makes you feel any better i didn't pay either time.

review_title: Two morons posing as directors produce a piece of crap
Seltzer And Friedberg Can Do So Much Worse
review_detailed_main:
After sitting through "Date Movie", "Epic Movie", "Disaster Movie" and "Vampires Suck", it has become beyond obvious that the duo of Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg deserve every criticism they have received. Their films are unfunny, unintelligent and unbelievably painful. There's nothing I can say about them that would make their work any more entertaining or any less stupid. So what do I think of their "300" spoof "Meet the Spartans?" Well..."Meet the Spartans" is Seltzer and Friedberg's best movie by FAR. Guess what? It still sucks.

What saves "Meet the Spartans"...Okay, um...Maybe "saves" is the wrong word. Uh...Anyways, what makes "Meet the Spartans" better and funnier than any other Seltzer and Friedberg film is that it has an EXCELLENT comedic cast. All of the actors chosen in this film seem to be chosen because they actually fit the roles and have tons of comedic presence instead of merely being chosen for star power. Kevin Sorbo has some very funny moments, Ken Davitian of "Borat" has good comedic presence and I actually found the whole concept of Diedrich Bader's character "Traitero" (A clever and actually really funny jab at action movies which make it incredibly obvious who the villain is the moment he or she steps on screen) quite humorous. That said, Sean Maguire gives by far the best comedic performance in the movie. This guy is given a script that gives him almost NO comedic possibilities and can truly turn out some hilarious moments. There are multiple scenes in this movie that would have completely and utterly failed in any actor's hands but his own. Seeing all these actors trying so hard to make this movie work despite such an atrocious script not only makes me like all of them more, it makes me hate Seltzer and Friedberg more for not utilizing their obvious talents better.

The biggest problem with Seltzer and Friedberg is that they don't view their movies as actual "films" per say as much as giant feature length comedic skits. Like all of their movies, "Meet the Spartans" suffers from this problem. Because of this, the film literally doesn't go 20 seconds without a joke. Joke after joke after joke is launched at the audience, and many of them feel rushed and without effort. It was like Seltzer and Friedberg just wrote down the first jokes that came into their minds without reading them over, fleshing them out or even double checking if they fit into context. And the toilet humor...Dear God, the toilet humor. The toilet humor here is so stunningly unfunny it could sink even an otherwise excellent comedy.

And if the toilet humor doesn't hurt your intelligence, then the constant pop culture references out of left field most certainly will. Apparently, Seltzer and Friedberg are people who think that a Spartan elder inspecting a baby Shrek is funny. No context by the way, the elder just inspects a baby and it happens to be Shrek, complete with a Scottish accent. If the film is extra cruel, it will combine its toilet humor and reference humor into some of the most unfunny scenes in the movie (I cringed HARD when a cat took a crap on Traitero's face after he randomly turned into Sandman)

Like I implied earlier, there ARE funny scenes in this movie, saved by strong comedic performances rather than an even remotely intelligent script. The "Deal or No Deal" parody, Leonidas speaking to the Prophets about his unintentionally homo-erotic battle strategy and Xerces revealing his blue screen as a secret weapon to create more soldiers are all legitimately funny scenes. Easily the funniest scenes I've ever watched in a Seltzer and Friedberg movie, but that's really not saying anything at all.

So yeah, "Meet the Spartans" is a terrible comedy. For most directors, this would easily be the worst thing they ever created. But for Seltzer and Friedberg, this is pretty much their magnum opus, and almost certainly the best you're ever gonna get from these two morons. At the very least it only made me cringe a few times, whereas I cringed pretty much every 30 seconds at "Date Movie" or "Disaster Movie."
And it still made me laugh as much as when I first watched it.

review_title: You would have thought they'd at least TRY and make a better movie than Epic Movie...nope, they made one that's even worse
review_detailed_main:
THIS MOVIE GOT A SCORE OF 0 OUT OF 10 BUT IMDb'S LOWEST RATING IS 1 Born to be the perfect Spartan, Leonidas faces numerous trials to becoming a man, including a face-off with a penguin. Once he has proved himself, Leonidas not only becomes king, but also marries superhot (and slightly slutty) Margot. When Leonidas learns that Persia's King Xerxes plans to make Sparta his own, he has his captain recruit Sparta's finest and prepare them for battle against invading Persian forces.

Meet the Spartans is from, yeah you guessed it, two of the six writers of Scary Movie and yet again fails to get one giggle. The story is yet again stupid, the acting is horrible, the characters are yet again made to be stupid for cheap laughs, the writing is awfulI can't honestly say a good thing about it. This makes any rubbish movie out there look like the best movie.

I watched this with an open mind since the last two movies they made by themselves were awful, I was hoping and praying that this would be at least watchable. Alas, it wasn't and the two writers still can't write any good or new material and they still disappoint. I wonder if they sat down with a pad and pen and said "What movie could we make that hasn't been done before?" and the other said "How about we make stupid characters, make them have a dance-off, get Carmen Electra again playing a slutty character and we could make pop references in random places that have nothing to do with the movie. I'm sure we didn't do that in the last two movies.", "it's genius!"hmm, that's probably how the conversation went.

Read more reviews at: www.dudedazzmoviereviews.wordpress.com

review_title: I tried to like this movie....

review_detailed_main: You'd think that Aaron and Jason would have got it by now that their movies are terrible. However, Meet the Spartans is an exception; it's abysmal. This film (if you can call it that) is basically a massive patched-up blanket covering a burning stack of money. The blanket is sewn together with idiocracy and each patch is a probe at pop culture. Did I mention that there are about a million patches? The writers seem to think they are comic geniuses, slapping audiences in the face with a joke in every line or/and shot. 'Attractive' females are used to make male audiences slobber into their popcorn, but they're probably already doing that due to their brains being turned inside out by the mind-numbingly awful sequences on-screen. Just take my advice and don't see this film.

review_title: Yeah, it sucked, but it made ma laugh at times...

review_detailed_main: Imagine getting raped by a rabid unicorn. What sort of pain would you feel as his rainbow releases struck your insides, turning your intestines to candy? How about shoving a pineapple up your rear? It seems painful to me. Despite this fact, I would rather have one of those, or many other tortures exacted upon me than be forced to watch this movie again. I guarantee you, go to any elementary school in the world, find their dumbest student (the kid who is in the corner covering his body in feathers and pom poms), and ask him about his bodily functions in detail. Whatever he says, no matter how inane, would make a funnier movie than this atrocity. As would babies getting cooked on an open stove. And handicapped people falling down elevator shafts. If you value your life, please, I implore you, burn whatever copy of this movie you see.

All of us have already watched movies that excess the human stupidity. Some of such movies include Dumb and Dumber, Ace Ventura movies, American Pie movies ... These movies definitely include scenes that are very humorous and also include jokes that have not been used before and are not too excessive. However, Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer get the award for crossing the line. They started out great with Scary Movie, but from there it seems like it just went down.

I've seen Disaster Movie, and surprisingly I liked it more than I liked this movie. Don't get me wrong, Disaster Movie still is a disaster. Meet the Spartans probably just seemed worse to me, because I have seen pretty much the same jokes that are used in Disaster Movie. Everything is filmed in a same way, the same jokes are used. Not to mention the bad special effects and all the scenes that we get to see.

To explain my vote of three stars - all of the jokes were not that bad and some can be quite a good laugh if you are in the mood for watching such a movie. I'm the type of person that likes things to be excessively stupid, but as I've mentioned before, the line is crossed in quite many of these films.

I still intend to see Epic Movie or Date Movie, though. I just want to make sure that all of these movies are equally bad and if they really use the same type of jokes all the time. If that turns out to be true, Aaron and Jason have to think about what they are doing before releasing any more movies.

review_title: A well made and clever Parody
review_detailed_main:
OK, first, I'm one of those that prefer watching Shawshank Redemption over Scary movie anytime.

Lately, I don't really like the shallowness and in-your-face-nature of parodies. I guess I was spoiled since I was one of those that had a chance to watch and enjoy "Top Secret!" 24 years ago. (yes, time flies by fast!) Gotta say though that this one stroke a note. It took the "politically correct" normally seen in movies from tinsel town and threw it away in the trash, which makes it such a great movie. That means that you won't really have to pretend you're enjoying this movie because you are the one that chose to rent it at the video store, but rather really enjoy it...

I can see the people liking Amer1can Id0l or Br1tney Spear5 not liking this movie though...Should I say more? Enjoy!

Meet the Spartans was just over 60 minutes long and full of excessive product placements. I wouldn't even call them product placement but just commercials. The following is a brief example; three minutes in to the movie the main character is starving and finds a Subway foot long sub sandwich. There was no joke made about it other than Subway foot longs are not very tasty. Coke was proud sponsor of the Pit of Death joke. Apple Computers was the sponsor of the "Wifely Advice" scene which failed to get a laugh. Maybe it was supposed to be funny that primitive men had advanced technology like laptops and cell phones? Maybe once but not over and over and over. Other proud sponsors was UPS, Red Bull, Dentyne, Gator-aid, Budweiser, T-Mobile, Gray Goose Vodka and The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf. Yes all those in just 60 minutes not much room for humor.

The jokes are in extremely poor taste, from child abuse, racism, homophobic slurs, overtly large male testicles, blurred shots of women's gentiles, and over done celebrity gags. The length of any given joke could last a long time. For example the "Pit of Death" joke ran a full 5 minutes long or 8% of this entire movie. There is a Paris Hilton joke about mid point in the 60 minute commercial that lasted too long and was later revisited again later for more pumping of an already dry well. Another gag that lasted 6 minutes or more, 10% of this film, was the break dance and yo momma routine and was an insult to the African American race. Promptly followed by a beer commercial.

The actors like Carmen Electra is really getting too old at 36 to play as a sex symbol to us teens anymore. Unless you're into dating your mother. To me she looks like an average soccer mom. If you want to see Carmen Electra nude look at an old Playboy magazine she is not nude in this movie and I rented the unrated DVD. Sean Maguire seemed to be in pain more than anything else. His acting ability suffers greatly and his ability to deliver the bad homophobic jokes even more so. I was actually sad to see TV star Kevin Sorbo from "Andromeda" and "Hercules" having to suffer through this movie. Not that he had much of a career but he has lost any hope in acting since this disaster.

As I mentioned I rented this movie for $2 at the local video store and when I took it back and told them how awful the movie was they refunded me my money. I hadn't spoken but about two sentences when the manager told me they couldn't in all honesty say it was a good movie to rent. They hope to rid themselves of the few copies they have in the store but since they are a franchise chain they must carry what they are told. I know just where this movie belongs at the very bottom. It should be #1 on the "IMDB Bottom 100 Movies". So vote and let's put this were it surely belongs!

review_title: a spoof film that hits on a lot of jokes
review_detailed_main:
In order to get this spoof, you must have watched the movie 300. This film follows the story in 300, but also spoofs many other films and celebrities. Just a list of some are American Idol, Dancing with the Stars, Deal or No Deal, Stomp, Paris Hilton, Brittany Spears, Brangelina, Spiderman. Carman Electra plays Leonidas Queen; she also gets around as Leo finds out when he sees her tattoo that says he was there, as well as Tommy Lee...all the way down to the Oakland Raiders. There are a lot of sex jokes as well as homosexual innuendos, like having the soldiers skip along singing and holding hands.

FINAL VERDICT: If you like spoof films like Scary Movie, Naked Gun, then you will probably like this one.

'300' is a film directed by Zack Snyder in which 300 warriors with no personality battle vigorously with another army. The CGI is good, Gerard Butler is good, but the film is pants and very repetitive.

Actually, Meet the Spartans made me smirk possibly once, maybe twice, actually possibly three times however for approximately an hour and a half, it is a dire movie made by catastrophic directors.

Sean McGuire is an amateurish actor at best while Carmen Electra is rather irritating. Awful casting doesn't bed well with few laughable lines, no story, no originality and certainly no entertainment.

'300' is a parody in itself and probably the more sensible selection of the two for a Friday night popcorn flick. At least there are rare flashes of entertainment to be shared with the bloody action flick through the amazing usage of CGI and imagery to capture the atmosphere of war.

Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are possibly the most cataclysmic set of directors ever to form a feature length film. Although, I do respect the former for originating 'Scary Movie' in the year 2000 which I believe still to be a rather good parody spoof.

To conclude - it's simple - watch at your peril!

review_title: About as funny and entertaining as anal rape.
review_detailed_main:
This was possibly one of the worst movies I have ever seen. That is no exaggeration. This movie is absolute SH*T. I watched it for free two days ago, and I'm still p*ssed about the fact that I payed for the electricity I wasted to power my television. I felt like RIPPING MY F*CKING EYES OUT

I HAVE HAD TEETH PULLED THAT WERE MORE ENJOYABLE THAN THIS

THERE HAVE BEEN GENOCIDES FUNNIER THAN THIS

OH GOD THE HUMANITY

Why in the good lord's name would anyone seek to produce a cinema representation of horse sh*t is far beyond my knowledge. This movie is the definition of cr*p.

Actually, I just took a dump an hour ago, and it was funnier than this movie.

I would rather use the DVD to slice my d*ck off than watch this atrocious monstrosity of a film.

review_title: Not horrible, but bad when compared to the other "movie" movies
review_detailed_main: I know I'm in complete minority, but I like the movie movies. Disaster movie, scary movies, epic movie, and superhero movie, they may suck, but they're funny as all hell. Yet this one just didn't get many laughs out of me, in fact, it only got one. The part where the lead spartan goes into Grand theft auto, then starts playing, Barbie girl, but other than that, it isn't that funny. It might be because I never saw many movies paradied in this film, but still. Well, at least the directors learned their mistake and fixed it with disaster movie, which brought back the funny. My recamendation, skip over this one, and go for the other great movie movies, unless you don't like parody.

review_title: Not as bad as the other Friedberg-Seltzer movies but still pretty bad
review_detailed_main:
As the movie begins we see a old Greek man inspecting babies. The first one is a baby Shrek and begins to throw up green slime. Then we have a vietnamese baby and a spartan baby. And then the movie unfolds as the spoof of 2006's 300. Lots of gross-out gags like the ones parodying CASINO ROYALE, GTA SAN ANDREAS and BORAT; such wonderful scenes as a baby knocking out a old lady and she spits her false teeth, a penguin jumping on the leading man with the stuff on his face, the fat villain that puts earrings in his nipples and much more.

Just like for the other parody movies by the genius team of Friedberg-Seltzer, the problems with this movie are: parodying everything and trying to cram everything in the movie; unfunny and juvenile humour, gross out gags that would make even a 12 year old bored to death and bad acting all around. The only two that looks like they are desperately trying are Kevin Sorbo and Carmen Electra, but the rest of the cast is bad.

There was one part that made me laugh: the one of the pit of death when Leonidas kicks everybody (including the AMERICAN IDOL jury, a Britney Spears look alike and her then-husband Kevin Federline, a crested rapper and many others) in the pit of death, and in one scene he kicks just like Jean Claude Van Damme. Just for this scene alone I give the movie a 3. Otherwise, it's pretty bad and forgettable.

review_title: One of the worst Spoof movies ever.
review_detailed_main: This movie is such a waste of your time , the jokes are really immature and they tend to drag on especially the jokes that are the least funny. As far as a spoof film goes all this film really spoofs are pop culture celebrities and references that are all dated. The acting in this film is just so bad there are no likable characters. In the end i felt as if i were watching a really bad really long mad TV skit, not to say mad TV is bad but its usually hit or miss and this film only misses. I would not recommend this movie even if it was free. The only good thing i will say is if you can sit through this horrible movie than any movie you see after this is just gonna seem extraordinary.

After seeing the mediocre "300" out in theaters previously, something needed to make fun of it. And this film does the trick. Not only is it better than the film "300" its funnier as well. And this is funnier in a good way.

Obviously in a movie like this there are numerous pop culture references. Such as Britney Spears shaving off all her hair, Ghost Rider, and those latest dance-off movies that have been released recently. And don't forget the references to American Idol. You can't go a modern movie without that.

But one of the most obvious things is the the indirect reference and allusion towards homosexuality (or at least bisexuality). The '13', since they could not find 300 men to fit the physical standards, keep up the gayness with men greeting men with kisses and the wearing of tight leather underwear. Obviously I could say a lot of things, but that would ruin the movie.

Overall, this isn't bad. I actually enjoyed myself. "B"

I knew full well going into this that it was far from citizen Kane, that said I have to say I laughed my @$$ off. This is one of those movies you just have to put your brain on autopilot. If you take your comedy too seriously this is not for you. My advice, get a few beers and watch with your girl friend or drunken buddies.

There may have been a few too many gay references, but over all I though it was funny the whole macho/homo-ness of the Spartans and how they tried to be tough yet in touch with there feminine side. We needed more pit-of- death scenes. And why didn't they do more with Britney and sangiha? While not every scene was super funny, over all it was good for a laugh. I did wait for the DVD and enjoyed listening to the audio commentary.

review_title: If you have low expectations, you won't be so bummed
review_detailed_main: Now cmon. Who actually thought this would be a good movie before they went to see it? Looking at the other films Seltzer and Friedberg have made did you actually think this one would break the mold of unfunny spoof films? I didn't, but I still like to actually see the movie BEFORE I rip on it. Now that being said, I got 100% what I expected: An occasional chuckle, but mostly lame jokes that are beaten to death, bad acting, bad direction, cheap looking sets and Carmen Electra looking more and more haggard with each passing movie. Even the product placement bits weren't that funny. These guys need to go back and watch Airplane, Naked Gun, Scary Movie 1, or even Spaceballs to see how a spoof movie should be made. The cutaway jokes on Family Guy rip pop culture far more effectively and much funnier than what this movie tries to do. Though I must admit, the idea of kicking annoying celebrities into a bottomless pit is a great idea, someone should've thrown the makers of this movie in there with them.

Just as bad as the movie they are trying to make fun of. Terrible acting, cinematography, plot, storytelling, overall direction and so on. The only thing that makes this movie better than the pathetic recreation of the battle at Thermopile ("300") is that it is meant to be a comedy. I guess if you are really bored and have plenty of money to spend, but no nearby charity to donate $9 to, and the only movie that is playing is this one, then sure, go see it. Otherwise, be wise, stay away, and do something better with your life. Try, for example watching some international, or domestic independent films. There is a lot more out there than Hollywood.

I think the spoof comedy movie genre needs a bit of a rest. With multiple movies of this type coming out every year, there is just nothing new or funny. Seltzer and Friedberg have done one a year for the last three years (2 in 2006 if you count "Date Movie") and just update the tired old jokes to fit with a new set of "current" movies.

That's not to say the movie was without it's moments, there were funny scenes throughout, but even when a scened was funny, they didn't know how to end it and move-on. For example, the spoof of the "dance-off" movies goes on forever, and there's only one joke. They couldn't even fill an hour and a half.

My recommendation, if you haven't seen it, wait until it is on HBO or something where you don't have to pay extra.

Somehow i managed to watch this movie, just because there was Carmen Electra in it.....:D But still she was not that impressive. Nothing new, same old booty moves and seducing looks but except for one scene where Carmen Electra is laying on a table with only tomatoes covering her nipples and a slice of pizza covering her crotch. Was expecting a bit more from her...was disappointed! And, about this movie i say......No storyline,Worst ever dialog's,Bad screenplay. At times u would just sit and scratch your head, thinking what the hell is going on...i cant even say its funny! its just so boring......I suggest you to watch this movie only if you want to add a movie in your top worst list. ha ha :D They made a spoof of themselves... Don't waste time downloading it, If u already did; delete it. If u purchased a DVD, break it & shoot yourself, for buying such a worst ever movie... before reading this comment on IMDb...:P Conclusion: this movie is strictly avoidable!

review_title: Are all the people posting comments that old?
review_detailed_main:
I've been viewing through the comments and all of them rated the movie 1 star or maximally 2. From what point of view, my question is, did you rate it.

This movie was a hilarious movie and perhaps the funniest I've ever seen.

I know you guys love 300 and perhaps took it as a mock but... it is a good movie.

Reading the comments, I realized or thought that people posting are old...

I think you guys didn't really get it but for a 14 year old kid, it was f***ing hilarious.

review_title: OK,but not the best movie I've ever seen!
I hated 300 and LOVE this movie for making fun of it

review_detailed_main: Who rates these things? Seriously. I watched the first 5-10 minutes and it is way obvious to me that I would not allow my 13 year old to see this movie. There are references to sex acts and profanity in every single scene! This is not comedic genius, it is idiotic obscenity. It isn't even funny. It is in extremely poor taste and shows no artistry whatsoever. Shame on the writers, actors, producers, and especially the poor judgment of whatever stupid agency rated this pg-13. So, not only is it definitely not appropriate for young teenagers, it isn't even worth watching for those that are not as concerned over censorship issues. It is just really terrible. I cannot think of anything I have seen recently that would compete well as the worst piece of "film" I have ever seen.

review_title: Only a blank screen would've been worse.... Maybe.
review_detailed_main:
You know a movie will be bad when the funny parts of the commercial weren't even funny.

Throughout this whole movie, I honestly think they used maybe three sets. I wondering if this was intentional, due to budget, or maybe on purpose (Though it's never mentioned in the movie).

Now, this is billed as a 'comedy', which usually means humor. Maybe the writers didn't get that memo. This has as much humor as... An ER? Possibly. The only attempts at "humor" (and yes, it deserves to be quoted) in this movie are references.

I can't imagine the "brainstorming" session the writers must've had: -"Okay, now they just talked to an enemy, what should we include to make this funny?" -"Let's put the American Idol judges in! They are from real life, so its funny!" (Though, judging from the script, they probably used smaller words)

Now, I have no problem with advertising in movies, or in video games for that matter. It seems to make it more realistic. (I'd rather a character eat at a TGI Friday's instead of a Wednesday's). But it's just plain blatant advertising here. After a character is stranded in the Arctic (or, going back to poor set design, a floor with cotton and white confetti on it), he only survives by seeing a Subway sub on the ground. Humorous? No. Advertisement? Yes.

Well, if you want about 80 wasted minutes of your life wasted, pick this up. If you enjoy good movies or at least some humor involved, just leave it.

1/10 (Too bad stars can't go to negatives)

This movie is terrible, no doubt about it.

I watched this movie with some friends, and even though we usually laugh of the most immature things when we hang out, we thought most of this movie sucked a lot. I have never liked spoof movies, but they can be fairly funny when you are together with the guys and being plain stupid. This however, is worse than the others I have seen (except date-movie), mostly because they have a tendency to overdo most of the jokes.

Then why did I give it three stars instead of one? You would think a 18 years old boy (me) was more mature, but I thought the gay-jokes were funny. When Leonidas marches to war with his warriors to Gloria Gaynors 'I Will Survive' I actually laughed wholeheartedly. I also liked the part when Leonidas was flirting with his general's son.

It doesn't save the movie, not by a long shot, and I wouldn't recommend this movie to anybody. But hey, compared to date-movie I did laugh during the film, so I couldn't give it only one star :)

review_title: Meet The Spartans; Why IMDb Needs a NO STARS Rating Option
review_detailed_main:
I'd seen Meet The Spartans on the shelves of the local rental store and got it when I was running out of choices and desperate enough to rent anything. Hmmm... no quotes from critics. That's ALWAYS a bad sign. Was it straight to video? But it started out with the 20th Century Fox intro so it couldn't be that bad... right? Perhaps I'm not qualified to give a review let alone rate this film since I thought it was idiotic by minute 1 and getting worst by the second. By minute 3 I'd already thought I'd wasted enough of my precious life and turned it off to get back to the HBO mini-series on John Adams. Now THAT is something worth seeing. It is for movies like this that IMDb does its readers a disservice by not allowing a NO Stars vote. The default 1 Star = awful ends up being too generous for trash like such as this.

So this film actually made it to the theaters?

review_title: I think the director has fallen on his head the day before they started filming

review_detailed_main:
When the history of movie making in the noughties is finally written, it will no doubt be agreed that the decision to green light a parody of a parody was actually a pretty good decision. (What's that? You don't agree that "300" was a parody of a swords and sandals epic? Don't be daft! Of course it was. Great film, though.) "Meet The Spartans" has bestrode (bestridden?) the U.S. film charts and is currently sitting triumphant at the top of the U.K. film charts.

Frankly, this is not bad for a film that has been, more or less, universally lambasted and criticised as one of the worst films of the year. I think it just goes to prove the truth of what William Goldman wrote in his fine book "Adventures In The Screen Trade". Nobody knows anything.

Anyway, what do I think?

The best bits: Nicole Parker's takeoff of Britney Spears, which was brilliant and made me laugh a lot, and Carmen Electra's body.

The worst bits: Er... Actually just about everything else.

"Meet The Spartans" really is a magnificently bad movie. Dog howlingly bad. Car crash bad. End of the world bad. Black plague, infestation of locusts, drought crisis, zombie holocaust, Sharon Osborne on "The X-Factor" bad. Bad. Very bad.

There is pleasure to be made in discovering a real stinker and, schizophrenically, I do not consider going to see "Meet The Spartans" a waste of an afternoon. I would recommend it to everybody just for the comparison required to recognise a good movie when you see one. Just try not to think of the money it must have cost to make this masterpiece and the films that could have been made instead.

Sigh.

Still, to look on the bright side, it was nice to see the U.K.'s very own Sean Maguire, of "Eastenders" and "Grange Hill" fame, all buff, grown up and achieving success in the States. I just hope that it is not the end of his career.
How are the reviews so low this film is a brilliant comedy defo my type of comedy.

I know I'm accepting a big risk in saying this, but I preferred this satire than the original movie. Really.

OK this movie is full of cheap easy jokes and references to other movies, but they managed to do this In very interesting way. It's not 100% idiot jokes humorless jokes.

It's really interesting seeing Kevin Sorbo playing a not-so-gay spartan. Its version of Xerxes is hilarious. And there is the gorgeous Carmen Electra playing a horny queen ... nice.

If you want to watch a movie with no cerebral pretensions but just some nice jokes for LOL, give this one a try.

review_title: Absolute garbage; almost true to its original intent.
review_detailed_main:
To begin, let's get something straight: this movie was atrocious. However, when calling it such, you must remember that this is the entire intent of the film, as well as most other true spoof films. Did this one have the potential to be better? Certainly.

Clocking in at just under an hour and a half, shorter if you exclude credits, Meet the Spartans is dry, oft-boring, and random to an extent that makes it difficult to tell when they're actually trying to tell a joke. Though well-conceived, the painfully short running time coupled with what was obviously a microscopic budget meant that this film came across as being far too much funny crammed into too small a space. The result? A new joke was on the screen before the previous one had yet to develop into a punch line, and the audience is left with nothing but a bunch of half-finished humor.

Now, about that 4 / 10 rating I delivered this dreadful film; don't get me wrong, the movie is garbage. However, there was the occasional moment in which an imaginative mind was able to have a slight deal of fun with the material presented, including one such humorous take on the excessive use of green/blue-screening in almost all modern films (that, and I reserve lower ratings for far worse films). The only real reason this had any laughable effect was because it was a joke re-used at what could almost be called the right times. Every other portion of humor present in the film was long gone nearly three seconds after it was generated and had absolutely no relevant bearing to the remainder of the film. It was much akin to telling of a murder mystery by introducing over eighty characters in the first half and then having them all leave while one man comes into the center of the frame and commits the crime in front of everyone. No joke was ever given time to develop, and no characters were given even the slightest amount of depth. Now, I know that's asking a lot from a modern comedy, but in all seriousness, I've had gas that had more character.

In all honesty though, it was still worth a laugh here and there.

This film will be particularly enjoyed by goldfish, who have a short enough attention span to enjoy all the jokes in sequence.

Oh the horror! What a movie. One thing is for sure, it is not what I expected. Sean Maguire tries to be funny but there's nothing sadder than a struggling punchline that doesn't deliver. This was too little of a parody to the blockbuster 300. Am sorry to say this but this is one of the gayest flicks you'll ever see. I seriously had to look at its makers.This movie is not even worth watching for free. Just stick to scary movie and the likes and don't dare watch this. And don't be fooled by the calibre of actors, they really do not pull it off. For the sake of your appetite for comedy. Enough said, just look for 'scary movie 4' and 'kungfu hustle'

review_title: A daily comment from Midget Emma: Meet the Spartans (2008)
review_detailed_main:
Okay, so i just met the Spartans and it wasn't pretty. It was better than both Date Movie and Epic Movie but that isn't hard to do. This was full of terrible jokes and dance battles and it only managed to have a few scenes that raised a laugh from me. So i recommend you never meet the Spartans.

If you hate jokes that go on and on then this isn't the movie for you. This movie was full of it. Seltzer and Friedberg still can't manage to make a spoof movie that is funnier than the Scary Movie series. I still hate your movies Seltzer and Friedberg but this was a step forward. This is a list from best to worst:

1. Scary Movie series.

2. Meet the Spartans.

3. Date Movie.

4. Epic Movie.

Epic Movie is probably the worst movie ever and i haven't seen Superhero Movie and Disaster Movie but i will be seeing them soon.

I don't recommend it but if you liked Date Movie and Epic Movie then you will want to see this. Terrible but getting better.

3/10

review_title: Oh DO stop exaggerating. It's not THAT bad!!
review_detailed_main:
And the IMDb critics rave: "Worst Movie Of All Time!!, "Worst Comedy Ever!!!!" Er...no, it is neither of the above. So please stop the hysterical ranting and take a chill pill...

I have seen some rotten movies in my time. Meet The Spartans would not be in my Top 100 worst movies - not in the Top 1000 even. It's a fairly innocuous bit of fluff. Mildly amusing, inoffensive, nothing special. It passed an hour.

I thought the core actors tried their best despite a less than stellar script. Sean Maguire certainly didn't lack conviction and turned in an admirable performance in the circumstances. I didn't like the celebrity impersonators. They weren't very good and if you're going to go down that road then you need people at the top of their game. The female impressionist was particularly dire -- didn't look or sound convincing in any of her roles.

However, the one thing that has most annoyed me about this movie are the parade of one star critiques on here. Not so much reviews as rants. The film isn't THAT bad. But even if it was, when someone says they hated first Date Movie, then Epic Movie, then Disaster Movie, why were they watching Meet The Spartans? Just so they could have something to complain about???

review_title: Stop Freiberg and Seltzer From Making More Movies
You would of though after epic movie the director's would of been shot but no there back with more rubbish.
review_detailed_main:
Right first of all i saw epic movie and it was the worst film i had ever seen so i really have no idea why i decided to see this (well i was in hope of seeing Carmen Electra in a sex scene) but i did. And by hell do i regret it there is nothing worse than a comedy that isn't funny ever if it is well made. But this isn't funny and could of been made better by a spastic with a camera phone, I laughed once in this movie and that was at myself for wasting 84 minutes of my life watching this pile of rubbish. The worst thing for me and most probably you as well is you just feel if the idea of one big parody was given to someone with talent it would of been a good film but instead it was given to a couple of idiots who Co-wrote scary movie.

As a whole i recommend you save your money but of you really want to go and see this bring a Ipod it will be far better that way.

I cannot believe that this kitschy, unintelligent, cheap-shot excuse for entertainment was committed to celluloid.

If you've seen the movie's trailer, you've been treated to most of the gags already. If you haven't seen any of the original films it parodies, or are unaware of the pop culture references it pokes fun at (Britney and K-Fed, anyone?), don't worry, the filmmakers are considerate enough to hit you over the head with them. If you appreciated any of the films it desperately tries to make jokes from, then by all means, avoid it.

I don't blame the actors,writers or director for the grievous experience I had watching this film. I blame myself. It was an extremely regrettable act, and you would do yourself a favor not making the same mistake.

This movie is possibly the worst movie i have ever seen, the one thing that still puzzles me is the fact that they ever get picked up by a film house who are willing to make it?????? The fact that the two director/writers have directed 4 movies, 3 of which have been released, and all 3 happen to be in the worst 100 movies ever made within the IMDb. This has a lot to say about their talent or lack of it don't you think? Also this fact doesn't look good for the 4th movie, the up and coming "Disaster Movie" later this year. I predict that this 4th instalment, from these two wannabe's, will meet the same fitting end as the first 3 and end up at around the 70's mark in the worst 100 chart. If you're wondering why I even watched this attempt at comedy, well, the law of averages says that if you do something enough you're bound to get it right eventually. Well, maybe after "Disaster Movie" later this year these guys might do what most normal folk do when they fail so, so often........................ Give up.

review_title: The best "spoof" movie of all time!
review_detailed_main: Ah what to write - funny from beginning to end. Perhaps its the rehashing of Kevin Sorbo tongue kissing the hottie lead, or the relentless campness and mockery of trashy celebrity and product placement segways - who knows but it sure as hell made me chuckle. The best spoof movie since Flying High.

review_title: Not that bad, for a 'focused' parody
review_detailed_main:
I don't know why so many people give this movie a bad rep. I mean, what did you expect? It's a parody, featuring Carmen Electra. Duhh! And it's only focused on a single movie, '300', so it doesn't have that much stuff to choose from and make fun of. Maybe they expected Kevin Sorbo to play Hercules again, saving the Spartans from certain doom! ;) Of course, that's not the case.

If you watched '300' recently, and u still remember the original scenes, and if u enjoy parodies like "Scary Movie", "Not Another Teen Movie" etc., feel free to watch this one as well.

As i said, it's not that bad.

review_title: A completely waste of time and money
review_detailed_main: Its one of the worst movies ever. Its pathetic how people is still making spoofs movies and even more pathetic that there's still people to watch them. This is already a wasted formula, there are very few funny moments because most of the jokes aren't even funny anymore and are beginning to become old and repetitive and the parodies are just weak. The cast is composed by unknown actors with the exception of Carmen Electra, Kevin Sorbo and the fat guy from Borat and all of them delivers poor and unconvincing performances. Even the special effects are poor. In conclusion, this was a completely waste of time, please people avoid this movie at all costs.

See this. There are no jokes. The writers are 13 year old boys. The okes revolve around seeing movies and the puch lines from the movies you've already seen. Plus Kevin Sorbo!. Do not support the idiots who write this shite. There is no comedy in this movie. A Mike myers movie is funnier. I can't believe someone wanted to put money into this.See this. There are no jokes. The writers are 13 year old boys. The okes revolve around seeing movies and the puch lines from the movies you've already seen. Plus Kevin Sorbo!. Do not support the idiots who write this shite. There is no comedy in this movie. A Mike myers movie is funnier. I can't believe someone wanted to put money into this.

review_title: These spoofs just get worse and worse.
review_detailed_main: Let's face it. "Scary Movie" was a hit. This is not. With every spoof movie this genre dies a little more. I do admit that there were a few bits that got a laugh or two but over all this movie was horrible. The jokes are played out and down right corny. I wouldn't even recommend renting this movie. This movie had a lot of "Mad TV" cast members in it who basically perform skits which I've seen on past "Mad TV" episodes. It's like the makers of this movie casted actors straight out of old skits. "Meet the Spartans" is old and just plain unoriginal in every sense of the word. Stick to the "Scary Movie" franchise if you're looking for good movie spoofs.

This was by far the worse ____ movie ever. Epic movie makes this look good. The acting was far below mediocre, the script was just a complete copy of 300's events except changed to be "funny". I didn't laugh a single time in the entire movie. It has gross moments, just spit and slime, apparently hilarious moments. Honestly, I'd watch any comedy movie available and still manage through, but this was by far the worst comedy movie I've seen all year. They spoof game shows throughout the show, not one is funny. Honestly, save your money and go see a decent movie. Watching the trailer for this movie makes it look hilarious, but after 100 lame ass jokes, even the remotely funny ones don't save the movie.

Who exactly are these idiots who give Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer money to make films? If they do have to exist in the same reality with us, the normal people, why in the gods name are they allowed to make films? we need to to stop this! It is a crime against humanity. I have never been physically affected by a movie. Until now. It made my stomach hurt.

The only reason why I watched it was curiosity. I have seen the reviews and i thought I had to see for myself what is so wrong with this movie. And it was a mistake. Don't do it. It just isn't worth it. I can appreciate a trash movie, but this is below trash category.. Much, much below..

Now, if you'll excuse me, I am going to vomit again.

The plot is very simple. Same as 300 with a load of retards and rubbish jokes.

First there was Date and then Epic. Now its Meet The Spartans. Why do they do this? Everyone hated the fist two films. Now they are spoofing 300. Why can't Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer accept the fact their films are bad. They are just wasting their money on these movies. If they keep doing this, then no one will want to see their films.

All they do is take one successful film and turn it into something trashy. Their are barely any laughs in this film. Its just actors acting like they need to visit a mental home. I don't know but they are just not funny. They try too hard.

I am surprised this hasn't won or been nominated for any razzie awards. They definitely deserve it.

Overall this is a terrible film that is not worth any money at all. Watching this film and coming out thinking "wow! I can't believe I have spend £7.00 on this crap," is not a good feeling at all.

If IMDb would allow me, I would give this film 0/10.

review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
This review is plain and straightforward.
review_detailed_main:
You are seriously wasting your time if you watch this film. There are a great deal more things you could be doing. Here is a list of just a few of those things:

1. Watching "Airplane". 2. Having supper. 3. Sleeping. 4. Reading a book. 5. Go and have a jog in the park. 6. Spending time with your children. 7. Birdwatching. 8. Seeing your friends. 9. Going on a roller-coaster. 10. Tidying your room.

Why this is not worth watching:

Because this is a terrible spoof film. Yes, there are a select few notable bits, but it is not worth watching the whole film to see them.

review_title: I don't think people know what a parody is
review_detailed_main: This isn't the original film. If you want a serious movie watch that. This is exactly what's expected a Parody, and a pretty funny one. There isn't a scene where I'm not laughing. 8.5/10.

It was all that you would expect from the previews. a comedy of a movie, 300, and some TV shows (I will not mention which, for i do not wish to spoil it for you guys). It is a movie that I would recommend for a single view, and then there is no reason to buy it on DVD.

It has a wide variety of jokes, pokes fun at current events, and the movie 300. I found myself laughing a fair amount of the time, and I also found myself shaking my head a few times as well.

a few faults with the movie, was all the gay jokes, there were just too many to be funny. there are a few spots where I found myself shaking my head at the distance they did to try and be funny with some of the jokes. there are a few gross jokes, and a few that could be considered to be abusive.

i give the movie a 6 for it did make me laugh, but faults took away from the movie in my opinion.

review_title: The Bigger They Are, The Harder They Fall
review_detailed_main:
PLOT: Exactly as "300."

Okay, I have so far enjoyed Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer's movies. "Date Movie" was decent and cute, but should've been better. "Epic Movie" was a step up from their previous film. I actually laughed a lot in that. Now here comes "Meet the Spartans." Let me say this now: This is by far the most disappointing and most irritating thing I've ever seen!

What happened?! I know people didn't like neither the other two films (even though I did) but I think I get what they're saying! Unlike their last two films (yes, they're different), this film is like a marketing campaign, for random items! I see it now: The films they make continuously have more pop culture reference than any other film. "Date Movie" wasn't all that much, really. Still have no reason why people didn't like that. "Epic Movie" had even more, but at least they were funny.

This is by far the lamest attempt to make something funny. There is a point (actually, an early point) in the film where I found it offensive on a recently dead celebrity. They try so hard to make this film funny! Okay, at first, I found some jokes funny. Then it all went downhill. I also find it sad more of the MadTV ensemble is in here.

This is like a MadTV skit. Each skit could be funny or fall flat. I liked the previous two films because each most of the skits were funny. Now, I did laugh at some parts for this film. I liked the Brangelina joke and possibly the jokes on homophobia until it really got very sad.

Other than that, the jokes are crude, sexual, disgusting, or predictable. If you're looking for action, don't bother. If you're looking for hot babes and hunky guys, you're in luck, because this film has so many to stare at. Other than that, there is no reason to see this film. I also think that the directors think audiences are getting stupider. The jokes to the reference of pop culture are said out loud, like nobody in the audience knew, like "It's HAPPY FEET!", "Thhe guy from BORAT!", "MaGuire from SPIDER-MAN 3!", "The TRANSFORMER cube!", etc.

Sure, the previous movies may ace but lame attempts to get laughs from the audience but they were funny. I found this one just stupid and idiotic and an insult to intelligence. Watch this movie for the great-looking stars. Don't see it for anything else.

review_title: Sometimes funny, but that wears out.

review_detailed_main:
What did you expect from it? From the director of Epic movie and Date movie, you will know what jokes it will have. The same stupid and disgusting jokes. Date movie is boring. At least I got some fun watching Epic movie. And come Meet the spartan, I did get some fun watching it but thought they should have done more better with it and not make it look like a low-budget movie. Honestly, I like spoof movies as I like seeing how they poke fun of movies. It is not bad but it is a bit boring. The only interesting part that perk me up is the war scenes.

Story: It is simple, the same story line for 300. Following the plot, there are spoofs of other movies being chunk into it. They spoof Spider-man, Deal or no deal and transformers etc. Sometimes, it is good to see people coming up with creative ideas for movies. Not that bad but they should think of better ideas.

Overall: If you enjoyed Date movie and Epic movie and other spoof movies like Scary movies, you would probably like this. Nothing else to say. Hopefully, in future, they will do spoof movies seriously and not make them like dumb movies. More spoof movies are going to be made. For example, in March, there will be Superhero movie. I hope they don't make it like trash. I like superheroes. Other than that, there is really nothing to say.

while i didn't hate this movie,i can't say i was all that impressed.sure,there were one or two gags that elicited a chuckle or two.but mostly,the movie was flat and the humour was irrelevant and nothing more than gross out.it was also,in case you were wondering,mostly unfunny,in my mind.i'd mention the acting,but there really wasn't any,since there was no script.at least a coherent one,that i could tell.i'm just glad i didn't see this in the theatre.that would have been a real bummer.my advice for this movie,if you really want to see it,try to find it for rent really cheap.otherwise,you might regret the experience.my vote for Meet the Spartans is a 3/10

review_title: Stupid beyond belief but not painful
review_detailed_main: I watched this movie as I marathoned the IMDb bottom 100, so I now how much movies can hurt. this movie does not hurt me. It has no self contained plot, and after five minutes of euphoric high caused by an almost its so bad its good, my brain adjusted to the randomness of the film I just watched it and attempted to guess the jokes before they happened for the remaining 55 minutes. My opinion on it is that it was a complete and utter waste of time, and the only reason it gets one star instead of three is that I PAID FIVE DANG DOLLARS FOR IT. I could go onto Youtube watch a summary of 300, the movie this is ripping off, then a video of a grown man crapping his pants in public, and finish it off by starring at a wall for an hour and get the same experience. They didn't even let me rent it on amazon, they made me buy it so that when I am watching a movie with friends I will have to explain why MEET THE SPARTANS is in my movie library. As a side note I watched this with two other people who both claim it was the worst movie they have ever seen and was so painful to watch one of them dropped out of the marathon. My theory is that this movie did not hurt me because I am a cynical nihilist who is not surprised that such horrors could be put to celluloid. So in conclusion I would not suggest this movie to anyone and if it doesn't cause you unimaginable pain it will leave a nauseous feeling because you will have to live the wrest of your life knowing you gave money to these soulless hacks.

A dismal failure of a spoof with only the slightest bit of funny. This dreck breaks all the rules of good spoofing.

1. Be timely. A joke about Ellen in Mr Wrong? Really?

2. Be funny when offensive. Accident prone kid in Scary Movie 3, mildly funny. Assault on a kid by Spartian, not funny.

3. Be subtle sometimes. Not everything has to go to the extreme.

4. Be broad. Go everywhere for your spoofs, not just the same wells over and over.

AND MOST IMPORTANTLY....

5. DON'T EXPLAIN EVERY RIFF AND SOURCE MATERIAL. If you have to tell your audience where it comes from, chances are it's not funny.

The fact that this film is only 60 odd minutes plus one of the longest credit sequences loaded with even more unfunny deleted scenes (seriously can't those wait for the DVD no one should buy either), that's just adding insult to injury.

review_title: 300 Spoofs Later, Hollywood Finally Taps Out This Lame Genre
As Bad as Bad Can Get!
review_detailed_main: One of the tricks to making a truly funny movie is that it has a real story line that is not a joke or gag but selectively inserts the jokes and gags when they are most appropriate. Alas, the makers of this steaming turd did not know the difference. Yes, 300 is a perfect movie to parody and with the budget and production values this movie has (very good) they could have made a great flick. Unfortunately, they seem to think that every single portion of the film should be some sort of gag. There are about 3 funny bits in this film. They are mixed with about 300 very unfunny bits. Pop culture parodies that don't work combined with sight gags that are predictable. I really cannot say enough bad things about this film. The makers of it should be barred from ever making another movie. It's not even the kind of bad that can be funny in it's own unintentional way, like a Steven Segal movie. Do not see this movie under any circumstances!

review_title: Whenever it was funny it wasn't intended ....

review_detailed_main: Just like "superhero movie", " scary movie", this movie makes me laugh so hard. It must be in Top 3 in parody movie list for me. I don't know why people gave it so low rating. I highly recommend, I've watched it 3 times and still funny. Ok so that's it I'm gonna watch it again today, thanks for reminding me. Peace out 🖖

review_title: Nothing Went Wrong, the Cineplex Had Its Birthday
review_detailed_main:
This is a spoof film. It means 'a film that parodies other films instead of having an art value of its own' in terms of characters, story line and the like, such as a happy ending. Why is it then that when I read reviews on this film, these reviews also seemed to spoof the very first review that commented on this film? Lemmings go over the edge into the Pit of Death, anyone?. The film was accused of recycling its material ad nauseam, yet those reviews recycled ad nauseam as well for instance the names of "good" spoof movies, such as Top Secret (Val Kilmer, you might remember). Oh, give me a break. Give me a royal Spring Break '08.

There is no such thing as a good spoof movie. The whole of this genre is designed to be disposable: it uses other people's leftovers and warms up once again thereof a passable meal, feeding the endless gluttony of moviegoers the world over. Therefore, it's pointless to flog makers of this fare, a bit like puritan Christians going after the makers of horror films. Even if the film was gross, it has managed to gross more than its budget back even now.

Sean Maguire was a convincing berserk of the Spartan kind. MadTV actress Nicole Parker did a few great impersonations. Xerxes was so fat and disgusting that he was almost hilarious. Carmen Electra brought some feminine relief to this otherwise masculine navel-gazing while the slice of salami pizza over her v***na was in particular seductive. The end song, "I will survive" tied up the loose ends and was the happy ending we wanted. Stop complaining. Don't watch movies of this sort with an empty stomach, on medication or whatever else was your problem (damp film student's socks?).

review_title: A one trick movie with a one joke punch line...
review_detailed_main: When I saw the preview to this movie, I knew it was going to be ridiculous, (as in not very funny). The whole concept of making a movie like this shouldn't have even been thought of in the first place. 300 has been out for only a year, and Meet the Spartans did it's best to defile it. (Which, it didn't even do a good job at that). If you see this movie, you must have a lot of time on your hands. Visaulize laughing at it's one joke, and then have that same joke repeated to you over and over and over again. The remainder is an attempt to tease this years' movies, t.v. shows, the trends, and the irresponsible celebrities that we're so sick of watching in real life. If you want to watch something that makes fun of other movies, watch or re-watch the classics, like Spaceballs or Naked Gun. Those were, and still are, funny. 2 out of 10

review_title: How to make a movie not funny.
review_detailed_main: A movie that is suppose to be a parody does not have single funny scene. It is also a movie that keeps get unfunnier every year because of how the movie only attempts at any type of humor comes from pop cultural reverences. Hey, guys, when you repurpose a disco hit to poke fun at gay men, not only do you look like pieces of garbage. You look like pieces of garbage who rip their jokes off of YouTube. Meet The Spartans gamely alternates between unfunny gay jokes and violent pratfalls for a good 80 minutes, finding time for not one, but two musical dance numbers set to "I Will Survive." At the end of the day. The film is a Witless, tasteless, formless spoof.

review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever watched.
review_detailed_main:
I think the purpose of this movie was for advertisement, specially American idol. Everything looked so fake and the acting was terrible. I don't see what is funny of many of these "jokes". The main bad guy transformed to literally fall a minute after, is that supposed to be funny?

Besides advertisement, it seems the purpose of the movie was to insult several celebrities and their life decisions or how they represent themselves. That may be funny, but again it was done in such disorganized manner that it was confusing of why they were introduced in the movie. Literally, anyone could have directed this movie. It was a collection of "funny" scenes in random order.

review_title: Some jokes land but everything else drags it down like a rock.
review_detailed_main: Though I haven't watched them in years and am unlikely to ever rewatch them, I used to have a fondness for parody films. They're not the best and probably miss much more than land in terms of comedy, but I guess I just like the incongruity of seeing out of place celebrities/modern product placement intruding in on the film, especially with films like this which are set thousands of years in the past. While I appreciated the incongruity of what was being referenced in this film, when it came to the actual quality of the comedy of those references, they ranged from mean-spirited (Paris Hilton and Britney Spears) to overlong (the entire "This is Sparta" sequence) to forced (which is technically everything) and the parodies of those celebrities weren't remotely clever. As a whole, I don't think the film got any laughs from me in that department. Now, when it came to poking fun at the eccentricities of Snyder's film or exaggerating certain scenes/characters in it, I was somewhat able to get on board with the film since that's the idea to parodying something, correct? The training scenes of Leonidas beating his son up, poking fun at the nudity/sex scenes in 300, exaggerating Xerxes' piercings, or painting abs onto the Spartans worked well enough for me. While it's not hilarious per se, that's what I want from parody films. There was more potential with parodying the excessive slow motion which they didn't capitalize on though, aside from recreating some of the slow motion effects at a couple points. As a whole though, I mostly found this really boring to sit through and frequently dry of clever jokes to keep me on board with it. I'd still give it some points for the comedy which landed, but everything else dragged it down like a rock.

review_title: A waste of time that barely qualifies as a movie.
review_detailed_main: Like every other movie from the writing/directing duo of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, "Meet the Spartans" is a braindead spoof movie that is absolutely awful, yet somehow still not worth getting angry at. It's nothing but idiotic slapstick, gross out gags, juvenile sex jokes, lame pop culture references, racial stereotypes and the most offensive gay jokes even written. Then again, when a movie is only 85 minutes, of which the actual movie is only an hour and the rest is comprised of credits and extended versions of already shown scenes, it becomes clear that nobody making it was even trying.

review_title: Perfect when you're either high or a 10yo
review_detailed_main: Maybe even both, and especially if you're watching it in spanish.

review_title: Spoof on 300 with a bunch of Hot Shots / Mel Brooks gags.
review_detailed_main:
What's wrong with everyone giving this movie 2,5. Now i know I should probably dig through other <5 rated comedies, seeing this pearl has gotten such a low score.

First of all, don't look for plot. It's there, it just doesn't care. Subtlety? Fuhgeddaboutit. The whole movie is like Mel Brooks on steroids. And don't say that this is hardly worthy of comparison with Mel Brooks. It's all the same humour, just that you were younger when you watched Mel Brooks and it was funnier then. OK maybe the plot is something Mel Brooks movies' do have, but the jokes are similar - completely absurd and arbitrary references, anachrony, bizarre jokes and a bit of slapstick humour. It's supposed to be corny. You're supposed to be used to that.

Second of all, it's a parody. A good ol' 80's style parody. Which means that some of the spoofs will just be an exaggeration of actual scenes from the original. No punchline. No meta-joke. Just a funny guy who speaks in an 'epic' accent who gets in a battle of wits (yo momma jokes) with Xerxes' RUN-DMC shirted crew. Stuff like that.

Anyway, the acting is bad, the montage is frantic, storyline vague.. But that was never the point. It's gag after gag after gag. You'll see all pop culture and modern references you can imagine, which will completely set you off from the "original plot". Yeah right.

Just think of the 80s, and remember your first impression of Hot Shots 2. This was even better.

After successfully skewering Hollywood's scariest movie (as two of the writers on Scary Movie), romantic comedy franchises (Date Movie), and Hollywood blockbusters (Epic Movie), writers/directors/producers Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer now set their sights on 300.

The heroic Leonidas, armed with nothing by leather underwear and a cape, leads a ragtag group of 13 - count 'em, 13! -- Spartans to defend their homeland against the invading Persians (whose ranks include Ghost Rider, Rocky Balboa, the Transformers, and a hunchbacked Paris Hilton). This is ridiculous. I mean watching a wall is more interesting then this. Meet the Spartans 3/10

Meet the Spartans is the worst parody comedy ever made, the writing is bad, the jokes are bad and so as every single scenes they showed. Except Carmen Electra, she's hot. But the movie, not so good like I thought it would be.

review_title: I've never laughed less during a comedy
review_detailed_main:
